content:
Posted: February 4
												It took me a while to write this review.  I wanted to give the game ample time to get fun before I offered a knee-jerk reaction based on unreasonable expectations.  My assessment: NBA 2k17 is a supermodel.  Looks very good on the surface, but still the same dumb blonde underneath.  The most frustrating part about the game is that it comes so close to being a genuine basketball simulation, but then it decides "nah, I'd rather act like a video game."  There are moments when you pull of a great play and it works the way you intended and you pump your fist like it's a real basketball game.  Sadly, there are too many moments when the computer (on Superstar or higher) will simply not allow you to score and won't allow you to stop the other team when it decides "let's make the game close so we can build a false sense of suspense, because 2K fans are too stupid to notice that we make them struggle to score in EVERY 2nd and 3rd quarter, then we flip a switch and they hit everything and they feel excited when they come back.  Cool, right?"  No 2K, not cool.  Let me blow out teams that I should blow out based on my skill level and the level of talent on my team rather than making severely overmatched teams like Brooklyn and Philly play like the Spurs because you think I want to be challenged.  It defeats the purpose of trading and roster moves and training if my guys are going to play down to their opponent every game.  Also, we notice when the AI-controlled teammates in both My GM and My Player decide their going to stand in the lane and play off deadly shooters just so the CPU can get easy baskets.  We tell the guy to play him tight, and our teammates play off anyway, cause....suspense.  We pick the guy to stop that from happening and hope our PGs can contain enough to stop the other teams PG.  They fall asleep.  We get the PG on the Pick and Roll and our center runs in place as is man rolls and gets layup after layup.  It's not fun for those of us who like defense.   The presentation of this game is beautiful--the menus, the pregame, the stat tracking--and it was a smart move to take away the silly MyPlayer angles that made that mode convoluted.  But again, the AI is too stupid for this game to pretend it's a simulator.  It could possibly trick a casual fan who sees LeBron looks just like LeBron and says its the greatest game ever, but for us die-hard hoop fans, it's like watching that beautiful supermodel stumble off the runway right before she pulls off a perfect turn.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2016
												I'm going to write an honest review for this game since A LOT of people seem to be very biased.This is not a perfect game. No 2K basketball game will ever be a perfect game. Does that mean this game is bad? No. Should you hold off on the game for now? Probably.Let's start with the positives:- A lot of people seem to gloss over the fact that 2K rehauled a lot of mechanics for this game. Shot meters feel more legitimate, this game is MUCH much more realistic (fouls, shot tendencies, etc...) This game is better and more fluid to control, and the gameplay reflects each players' ratings (defense, shots, etc...) much more accurately.- Online play seems to be better and more fluid. I've yet to encounter any latency issues online with quick play and the such.- MyCareer is MUCH better than last years. There is no cheesy story and the cutscenes feel much more integrated into the game. Orange Juice and dynamic duos are a great idea in general. The UI for MyCareer (and the game in general) is so much cleaner and more functional.- The game is visually beautiful, not much else to say on the matter.Now, the cons:- Help defense is broken. It's quite ridiculous that 2K hasn't fixes this lingering issue in such a long time but it's still there. This is a BIG issue in MyCareer and not quite as bad in other modes since you can manually control players.- Stat allocation is broken. This is a huge issue in MyCareer and has deterred me from playing the mode any more until 2K fixes this issue. Introducing the idea of stats that can only be raised in practice is actually quite a neat idea. However, these boosts are not permanent, even though 2K has stated they are. This is detrimental and demoralizing and discourages players from playing the game more. Limit caps are ridiculously strict as well. 2K NEEDS to fix these issues ASAP.- Numerous glitches.- 2K introduced broken mechanics along with the good mechanics. Ankle breakers are now pathetically easy to pull off (using Stephen Curry behind the back moves is a surefire way to have your defender fall). Moving screens are now a thing. I would hold off on buying this game until 2K patches it. There are just too many issues with the game that prevent it from being a playable game. I like this game. I really do. That's why I'm hoping 2K listens to the community and starts working on the issues at hand immediately.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
												NEW PLAYERS: Overall, one of the best basketball games in the market, but can be hard to pick up. If you do, you're in for a treat. (See below)FEATURES:    - High quality visuals for a basketball game (or any game, really)    - Very immersive MyCAREER mode    - MyPARK: a game mode where your MyPLAYER can play pick up games with others online    - 2K PRO-AM: create and customize teams and play online    - MyTEAM: the ultimate basketball card game; build your team (of current and former players) and play against others online on the hardwood    - MyLEAGUE / MyGM: if you prefer controlling a team from the top-down (+ new features!)    - CREATE A PLAYER: in-depth player creation with several new categories    - SHOES: give your players some sexy sneaks. Available for MyPLAYER as well[From here it's more in-depth.]RETURNING PLAYERS: See below.MyPROS:    - MyCAREER immersion is the best in NBA 2K history    - Handles feel great    - Face scanning available for PC players now    - Better AI + more control over them    - Kobe and Michael B. Jordan welcome you to MyCAREER, not Spike Lee    - MyNBA2K17 mobile app hooks you up with easy VC    - Much cleaner UI    - Amazing soundtrack (if you're into rap, especially)    - Lot more player customization (animations, attributes)    - No Spike Lee    - Faster MyTEAM unpacking animations    - Dynamic Duo / Orange Juice mechanic is a free stat boost    - Very natural dribbling in between plays    - Arms are actually tangible; you touch the ball, it's out of their / your hands    - Ball isn't on a string; higher mechanics now used for offense    - Harambe logos    - Better, race-neutral MyPLAYER voice compared to the past (never mattered to me though)    - Better player celebrations    - Pres is a decent nickname, but what isn't compared to Frequency Vibrations    - No freqin' and vibin'MyTRIGGERS:    - Questionable player ratings (as of 9/20/16)    - Occasional FPS drops    - You start MyCAREER with a really low rating (as usual)    - Justice Young has better ratings than you    - MyPARK is just 3 ghost towns    - Sound is glitchy (e.g. player interview with PA going off)    - You can't make the player you want with the categorization of playstyles    - If you're a lower draft pick, you can't skip to yours in MyCAREER    - Your MyPLAYER has unforgiving attribute caps (e.g. low free throw and stamina ratings)    - The '+1 stat' you SHOULD be rewarded disappears    - No yeezys?    - Unskippable cutscenes    - Many players' faces are completely off    - Not the most hacker-proof game out there (as usual)    - You can still select 'Freq' as a nickname    - Lots of attributes for MyCAREER aren't recorded or saved    - Can be difficult to master the mechanics, especially for newer / returning players    - Spike LeeMyTIPS:    - For face scanning, use an iPhone front camera while right in front of really bright white light        * Turn slowly, and per angle.    - Lower the difficulty to:        * Rookie if you're getting crushed or are fairly new        * Pro if you're fine at the level the game puts you at initially        * All-Star if you're ready to play at a respectable level        * Superstar if you need a challenge        * Hall of Fame if you want to find out how hard of a punch your monitor can handleMyREVIEW:    - The latest installment to the NBA 2K series, NBA 2K17, is one of the better basketball games on the market ever--by default. It has a deep career mode, unlike any other game in its genre, but has once again failed to make it the best through acclaim. Its career mode--arguably the most anticipated part of the series now--tends to make critical errors annually. If you want to have the best career, then go buy 2K11. If you want to have the most IMMERSIVE career, then take this game.    - If you're new though, this game might be a headache. It's not the perfect game, it's just the "best basketball game" created, arguably by default. Lots of fun if you put in the work, but if you're way more casual than a lot of 2K players stick with the games that came out in the past.    - MyTEAM, MyLEAGUE/GM are back again and they've been upgraded. Had no issues with their content before (minus the actual gameplay on the COURT; that's another story), and even made adjustments to make the modes more enjoyable. (See MyPROS.)    - Several new mechanics have been introduced this year, including shot / pass aiming and the dynamic duo system. It certainly increases realism, but the game has too many other holes already for 2K to be working on something like that. (See MyTRIGGERS.) There are many issues that I'm sure you'll read about in the other reviews floating around, but the positives in tandem with them bring me to these opinions:MyTHOUGHTS:    - FOR HARDCORE 2K FANS: Must buy    - FOR CASUAL 2K FANS: Great game; best 2K since next gen graphics    - FOR NON-2K PLAYERS: Get it on sale    - FOR ALL: No Spike Lee MUST BUY $$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

Posted: December 11, 2016
												The gameplay aspect of this game series is getting worse and worse every year. Ever since VC became a thing 2K has turned this game into an unbearable and unfair grind, just so that you get so aggitated that you either quit playing the game or buy millions of VC to upgrade your player and buy overpriced gear and other stuff. I call it "VC baiting".Also with this year's edition you'll feel less in control of your player and the game itself. The presentation, though beautiful, is long winded with never ending unskippable cutscenes and animation loops. There are so many interviews, commentaries, Pre and Post game shows that you'll spend most of your time being a spectator of the game! 2K is running this show and you are their puppet!New to MyCareer is this tag-along player Justice Young. He'll be your 'friend' throughout your NBA career and in my case played the pointguard position on my team. And whenever you're on court he is and the two of you will share a Duo Super Power called Orange Juice... Yeah Orange Juice (dear goodness ). I bet an intern at 2K came up with MyCareer for this year after Mr Lee's debacle last year. Anyway... I don't want Justice on my team! I resent him (He's better than me)! I want to play with real NBA players, with only myself as a semi fictional character.I haven't even bothered playing MyPark, didn't like it last year and won't like it this year, with an army of cheaters, ball hogs, idiots, rage quiters and also spending minutes wasting time waiting to play a game.Now to be fair they have improved Pro-Am adding the much requested earning of VC and my personal wish of being able to play on court while the game searches for other players to join the match. And having AI teammates join you on your own court is also a nice touch.I'm just fed up with NBA 2K by now. I just want to play a good and fair basketball simulation and not a virtual basketball presentation game. Here's hoping EA gets its act together with their NBA Live series this year. In the mean time I think I'll just dust off my copy of NBA 2K11 and pop it in my trusty PS3.Pro's- Great visuals (The only thing you can bet on 2K delivers each year)- Nice soundtrack- No Spike Lee- Pro-Am improvements (including earning VC)Con's- VC baiting- Online Cheaters- Justice Young- A lot of waiting for animations, cutscenes etc- Control of your player often taken away from you- Unfair gameplay even in offline modes- Some players look very skinny, like KD for example

												Well, I can't say it's a bad game, because gameplay mechanics are great, probably the best sport game on the market. But my problem is it is getting more and more free-to-playish every year and 2K Sports seems to be doing everything they can to make us pay for VC. Getting it in the game is painfully slow and every upgrade/piece of inventory/animation cost so much. What is ridiculous is that you can pay 100 euro for 250 000 VC and that's still won't be enough to fully upgrade your player! It's 2x cost of the actual game! Also, MyPlayer feels stupid now. I don't understand the point of caps on atributes, if it's my fantasy of playing in the NBA as 2 meters tall NBA player I want him to be the best in everything. I choosed a slasher SF and for only 10 000 VC I can upgrade his 3-point shooting to whooping 59... That's gonna be probably 20% on 3-point shots :) Also 2x multiplier for playing in MyCareer on HoF difficulty doesn't work, so getting VC takes even more time. Another thing that is annoying is that all game modes use same VC, so you have to commit to one of them if you want to be really good at it. Don't get me wrong, it's a great game, lot's of fun, but 2K Sports gotta stop this VC ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, because everything in this game is made in the way, that makes getting VC slower, even cutscenes in MyCareer are unskippable, so u gotta watch your player talk on the phone with his mom about his dead father and u don't give a♥♥♥♥♥♥about any of them. I can recommend this game but cannot give it a positive grade because so many things are wrong about it.

content:
Posted: March 2
												I've been somewhat fanatical about basketball games since my earliest years. I've been through them all, Basket master on Spectrum, the legendary Lakers vs Celtics, the whole Nba live series (until it went sour) and ofcourse 2k's Nba 2k. I still can't wait to get my hands on each version, even at 35 years old i long for the release day like a child. I just love playing basketball. Real as well as virtual. So how did 2k manage to ruin all this for me? You almost have to really try to ruin that kind of a relationship, but disregard for your player base will certainly drive away even the most religious fans. Before i start furiously ranting i still need to acknowledge the positives of the game. First and foremost, you need to realize that at its core the mechanics of the game are exceptionally good. The way the game flows, the way the players move, shoot or interact with the ball, collisions, shooting, dunking, you name it. I imagine recreating movement is one of the hardest things in game developement and 2k does its job brilliantly. You can easily distinguish players for their individual traits, like John Wall's handles, Durant's shot, MJ's up and unders. Whatever it is you're looking for, individuals are recreated to near perfection. Each team's strategy and playbook is very well done aswell and there's an integrated adapted a.i. engine that will adapt to how you play the game and it will counter and challenge your approach.Also the atmosphere in the arenas, sounds, commentary, almost everything about presentation is deliberate and exceptional. There are certain elements like the pregame show that are somewhat wooden, especially the halftime interviews, but a serious amount of dedication went into presentation of individual arenas, players, teams, the action, you name it. Granted some commentary about specific players gets annoyingly repetitive but that's mostly about the players on a team you are a part of (in my career), or you're playing mostly with. There's also a vast array of options as to what to do in this game.you literally do not have the time to explore all the game modes in depth, because the content is just massive. You can play exhibition games with current teams and rosters, you can play a story mode in my career and create your player there and play through his evolution with a story that goes along with it, you can create a fantasy team in My team, or you can play a manager type of mode if you're more into that sort of stuff. I don't have the time to go into in depth details of individual modes and i would also do some injustice since i don't play them. For the majority of people the game's most fun mode is to create a player, develop them and then play multiplayer games of streetball 3v3 in My park or 5v5 pick up games in pro-am. You can also pick a team and play in leagues with that team if you preffer that. Overall, if i would have to judge the game solely on its mechanics and presentation and the amount of content i would give it a strong 9. As for the graphics i have to say that the game engine is getting outdated and could be better, but they did squeeze out a lot out of it, and it does still look solid. So what's wrong?Well first of all, it's the bugs. It's amazing to me how the game is still flawed with similar bugs that have plagued it for years like crashes, multiplayer games not starting, etc. each year the game is very flawed at release date and does get patched out eventually but it's just not tolerable in terms of approach. Then there's the animations. Each year they claim how you will no longer get stuck in animations of players, but in fact you still do and some are just crippling and annoying as *insert word*. And each year there are cetain cheese moves that people exploit and it literally makes you wanna strangle someone because it's something that will just not happen in real life basketball very often. The most annoying one this year are the charging fouls for example. They can drive you crazy. Then there's stuff that's just goofy, like other turnovers. Sometimes you pass to someone in the open lane who's 5 metres away and the pass will go out of bounds. God forbid you should attempt passes over half the court. Even with able playmakers. While i regularly make them in real life, half of them will be turnovers here. It's just unrealistic. And perhaps the worst if it all is the amount of steals the cpu makes. Makes you wanna cringe and explode from hate. It's just ridiculously hard to pass without the cpu intercepting the ball. Especially in proam games which regularly has some a.i. players since a lot of players disconnect or have some connection problems/crashes, etc. the cpu players are also ridiculously useless as teammates most of the times. Not so much in situations where you play against ai, but when you're stuck with cpu teammates against a made player squad, you're dead. They miss easy shots, are horrible on defense... basically the a.i. is just plain bad in this game. Granted, this kind of ai is MUCH more sophisticated to program than cpu opponents in some first person shooter, but still!  Also i have to touch on the story aspect of my career. Granted it's nowhere near as horrible as last years's Spike Lee debacle, but it's still downright ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I hate it. Period. And now the main reason. The reason why i no longer yearn for the next year version and why i will no longer buy games from this developer/publisher. CHEATERS! Cheaters everywhere. For the past few years now the community has been losing its mind. There's so many kids who use something called a Cheat engine to raise their individual player's attributes and abilities to godlike levels where they become unguardable, it's ridiculous. They effectively ruin your experience and all the fun, yet 2k sports either don't mind or are just completely arrogant to these facts. We literally flooded them with pleads,requests,petitions, flamed them, and then some. They just DON'T CARE. It's getting worse too. I can't stand for it, i will not support such bad practice and i've never felt so unappreciated as a customer in my life. Not only that, they're also insanely greedy with micro transactions. In order to really be able to compete against other players you have to really develop your player's stats and attributes. You either grind to earn ingame value known as VC or you pay real money to buy them. But it's gonna take you considerably longer if you decide to earn enough through grind. Ofcourse some will just hack this too. To be fair, they will ban people for that kind of hacking though, because god forbid 2k shouldn't earn money from you. Until 2k changes its attitude towards the pc community and implements some kind of anti hacking measure i cannot recommend this game. I highly advise you to not support this game. Then again, you have no alternative since it's the only real basketball game and this is exactly why they behave as they do. But sooner or later they will get competition. And i am very sure most of the community can't wait till that day comes because they will be willing to pay double just to shove it in 2k's face, as long as the other product is on par with it.  I really wish i could recommend this otherwise great product but they simply do not deserve it. Stay away!

												So after 240 hours in 2k16 and 20 hours in this, I can really say it improved in almost every point. So I am just going to make a quick pro and con list:pro:-new handle system is easy to learn but hard to master (you can really create your own combos and make some nasty ankle breakers)-graphics and sound improved even more-AI improved by a big margin-Blacktop now has people watching you play, cheering etc-the soundtrack is once again amazing-playing as a team (for me personally) is way more fun in this part-the story and the cutscenes are amazing and they seem to never stop-endorsements are awesome (you can sign with a shoe company and get your own shoe for example)-the dynamic duo system is fun-the halftime/pause shows-you can rewind the whole game in instant replay now-much more which I fail to remember right now but those are enoughcons:-somewhat underated player ratings (Isaiah Thomas, Dwyane Wade, Damian Lillard..)-already 90+ ovr players in mypark-it takes way to long imo to get a new upgrade from working out-some weird sound and animation bugs but they aren't a big contraAll in all I'd give this game a 9/10, it's so much fun and even more fun with friends. Everything looks and sounds so good that I just don't want to stop playing.

content:
Posted: February 12
												As most of you reading this will know, NBA 2K17 is the best basketball simulation game right now. However, the reason behind this fact is that it's the only game out there and the lack of competition is hurting this game tremondously. As there is no longer any needs to make sure that its gamers would not switch to other series like NBA live, the game continues to evolve further and further away from gaming entertainment and its community. Overall the gameplay is an overhaul from the previous installment of NBA 2K16 as the player movement is becoming more and more robust, however specific algorithms of the game is getting less and less accurate in terms of simulating a real world experience. For example, contested shots are basically impossible to make in this game, meaning that the Kyrie shots over defenders are entirely impossible to simulate in this game and the difference between players are getting less and less significant and there are very few things a bench player could not do that a star player can. In fact some of the most lethal players in this game are rather low rated, but due to various reasons they are able to do the things done by all-stars to a respectable level. That itself is a little concerning as the realism of the game is not quite established.The biggest problem with this game, however, is an extremely fatal one. In this year's game, playing online -- something that is possible ever since the original 2k on DreamCast -- is basically impossible. On the steam platform, it is basically impossible to play a game online at an acceptable level of satisfaction. Not only is the server extremely unreliable, causing endless crashes that will destroy a team's promotion and records, the players on the servers are mostly unacceptable to play with. While I am sure that there exist honest, respectable players, they are overwhelmingly out numbered by cheaters, hackers and ones who exploit the system of the game. From off-balling in a my-team match to spamming steal due to the same foul-out rule in half of an actual game's time, the game itself encourages players to play irresponsibly (e.x. a player gets fouled out in an 48 minute nba game if he commits 6 fouls, or 1 foul per 8 minutes; where as an online game is only 20 minutes long and 6 fouls translate into 1 foul per 3 minutes). Much worse, hackers are able to cause their opponents to lose by crashing the latter's game app to force a loss, and cheaters are able to alter the auction house rules by bidding at less than 110% of the previous bids. With all evidence in mind, this is to say that the company has utilized their resources (mostly the purchase of gamers) into advertising campaigns instead of actually making the game more playable. This could be explained (no competition, again) but is definitely not justified. Also, this probably explains why quality players are lacking in this game, likely due to that they have given up wasting time online.Overall, the gaming experience is pleasing when offline, and disgusting when played online. For those who own nba 2k16,  the need of an upgrade is minimal, meanwhile, it is still a relatively good game if one can keep away from playing online.

Posted: November 2, 2016
												as a hard core NBA fan and gamer, I'd suggest to avoid this game at all cost. I didn't listen to all the negative reviews and wasted $$. dont make the same mistake as mine. that being said, this game is the best NBA/basketball game one can ever get every year. for 2k17, the graphic, gameplay, music etc are all pretty decent. what makes this game dead terrible is its microtransaction. the progression is designed around microtransactions, which means is painfully slow. In order to increase the attribute of your player, you have the following options: 1.spend real money to buy VC(in game currency) on top of the $$ you already spent to buy the game to increase your attributes. for every character your want to play, be ready to spend about $70 to level it up. Want to play a shooting guard after playing a play maker guard? $70, forward? center? $70,$70....2.grind vs AI, suffer the same gameplay/animation(btw, you can't skip cutscene, and it gets old and frustrating really fast) for countless hours to earn VS, for the value about 30 cents real $$ per hour. there is no replay value of myCareer, but that's almost the only way to level up your character..3. search for glitch,cheat, bug online and use them, which pretty much all the top 2k streamers, youtubers, everyone in myPark uses. when the whole community have to either cheat or spend a tons of real $$ in order to play the game, you know there's a huge problem. You may ask, why do I have to increase my attributes? you don't have to if you just play offline vs AI. if you ever want to go to myPark and play vs real people, you'd find out that everyone there have an average attribute of 90, and your character after playing for 30,40+ hours without using cheat or spending $$ have about 65..    as long as there's pay to win microtransaction in this game, don't ever buy this nba2k or any future ones.

												Pros:-New layup and post play animations-Shot meter rework and layup shot meter-Better story than last year-Orange Juice mechanic-Off-days rework - now allows you to get all endorsements and connections at same dayCons:-Fully priced game with microtransactions-Invisible players and players with invisible limbs-Insanely high foul rate - sometimes even 20 fouls per quarter-Incredibly high pace - game finished with 120+ points for each team-Practice upgrades not saving**-Yo-Yo dribbles still present-Player grabbing/bumping/chucking that gives you no control of your character-Opposing centers dragging guards to the paint leaving shooters wide open-Double team cheese**-Shot meter glitch-Players doing fastbreak pullup threes instead of going for a layup with wide open lane-Players doing fastbreak pullup jumpers/threes with fully set defense, instead of setting up offense-Centers shooting midrange and baseline midrange jumpers (Centers like Howard, Biyombo, Whiteside etc...)-Sharpshooters meta in MyPark-Floaty passes**-Missing 92' Dream Team preorder reward**-Subtitles not always showing correctly what is said in cutscenes-Justice Young progression doesnt match the story-No rep rewarded in ProAM games**-All-Star weekend in MyCareer broken-"Error has prevented the gameplay from continuing..." and then you get a loss-CPU players standing out of bounds for no reason-CPU teammates playing terrible (help) defense-CPU players doing a stepback on wide open shots-Lightweight ball that goes accross the court after a block and nobody can catch it, or just goes to 46th row-Zero effort put in park - same parks as last year, only recolored-Cutscenes not skippable after first character-Referee delaying the game by not passing the ball for inbounds (seems broken because of commentary)-Cheaters, cheaters, cheaters and 2K does nothing about it-Same graphics as last year but worse performance-MyTeam even more pay2win with normal players nerfed to ground - trying to squeeze as much money from OP cards from new overpriced packs-"I'm Pres and I approve that steal. Presidential pardon."If you are a person that likes playing basketball, enjoys watching basketball and understands how the game of basketball works, unfortunately this is not a game for you. All you can get is frustration from dumb CPU teammates and from cheating CPU opponents that dont care about how good your defense is. MyPark and ProAM are fun with friends, until you play against sharpshooter that makes every shot from halfcourt...I'm aware that things marked with ** are fixed with last patch (that is not live on PC yet, even though it has been on PS4 for over a week), but i stated them anyway because i think the game shouldn't have been released in this state, especially since most of these things can be seen in only 1 day of gameplay.What I would like to say, wait for few more patches, slider and tendency tweaks and then buy it on some discount, because currently it is definitely not worth the price.

number of helpful: 42 of 55 people (76%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
												I've logged close to 100+ hours on 2K17 (prerelease). I'm a career mode buff and have been attracted to MyCareer ever since 2K13 came out (that was my first basketball game, admittedly). I honestly think that I'm having a crap ton of bittersweet moments playing this game: it's realistic, it's fluid, and it makes you feel like you're watching/playing an actual NBA game. However...It's clear that 2K doesn't give a flying turd about PC users. Not only did I have to wait twelve hours for the game to be prereleased (it was released at midnight on 9/16 for Xbox and PSN, I was able to "predownload" it and finally was able to play it at 3 PM that same day), but I have to put up with a very important patch being released later. This is honestly one of the worst basketball games I have played, but I have no choice but to keep playing it. Why? It's literally the only thing out here. I'm ready to call for Ronnie 2K's suicide, at this point. That would be the one thing to make this entire series better.As far as gameplay goes...it has its' moments, more terrible than decent. I was drafted by the Celtics, and Al Horford took a jump shot instead of driving the wide open lane. You are immediatley double teamed once you cross half court, no matter the difficulty. The MyCareer archetypes are WAY too restricting. You are now limited to being a role player rather than a superstar. Of course, he missed with the game on the line, and I had to put the game down for a few hours. The help defense is simply laughable; half of the G.D team will flock to a pick and roll and leave two or three guys wide open. Also, the turnover system is very weird. If you throw a pass that a teammate catches out of bounds, the receiving teammate is responsible for the turnover. This is very frustrating if you catch a fast break pass along the sidelines and you are hit with this stupid, ridiculous animation and cause a turnover on yourself. I believe it was a promise by the developers that said "lol u wont get stuck in animashuns this yeer". And?Nope! You could be doing a swift behind the back move, be bumped into a defender, and turn the ball over. Also, spacing in the game is horrendous. More often than not, your teammates will clump themselves together at the top of the key, setting screens that nobody uses. On the defensive end, this makes it almost impossible to stay on your man, as you get jostled about far too often. Commentary gets repetetive and I've found myself skipping over the intro scenes. Also, I enjoy cutscenes and the story that MyCareer brings, but you can't skip them. I see how that could be a nuisance for some people. Defenders will also magically catch up to you if you beat them to the lane. I was driving on James Harden, who is a notoriously hideous defender, and he literally popped from his perimeter position down to the elbow. What the absolute f*ck is that? It's funny, because Demarcus Cousins is described as one announcer as having a "shoot first mentality", when he constantly passes out of the post and averages 7 PPG in my second MyCareer. Also, there is one animation that is literally broken. Down by 3 in the fourth, I passed to a wide open Rudy Gay, who did a stepback move (despite being beyond the three point line), and he completely missed. That's the result 95% of the time with this animation.You want a good basketball game? Wait until that scumbag Ronnie 2K cleans house of his developers and starts all over again. The MyCareer story is literally the only redeemable quality about this piece of sh*t. Mind you, I said story, not even gameplay. This game is complete and utter trash, and I highly advise that no one buy it as a gift for anyone this holiday season.

content:
Posted: April 13
												I noticed this game went on sale today (4/13/17), so I'm gonna throw out this quick review for anyone interested in the game.It's good on PC, but only if you're gonna stick to singleplayer modes like MyCareer and not worry about MyPark and going online to search for games and such. There's two big reasons for this, Lack of players and Hackers. It's fine if you're gonna do a private game with a buddy, but searching for a public game is not really advised. If you're lucky, you'll fine some normal players on MyPark, but it's usually an empty wasteland. If you're gonna be playing online a lot, consoles might be a better option compared to PC. There's just not that many players on PC, and when there is, most of them are using hacked 99 rated players with 100% shooting accuracy.In terms of MyCareer, it's a great mode, and easily my favorite mode right now. You'll need an online connection to access the 2K Store to buy clothes, shoes, custom bands to wear in NBA games, custom MyCourt floors and backboards, and much more. So if you're gonna be completely offline with no internet, MyCareer may be a bit lackluster and bland.In terms of bugs, I haven't found anything extreme. There's quirks here and there that can easily be fixed by the devs, like opening the MyCourt pause menu pausing the music when it's not supposed to, but they just haven't fixed it yet for some odd reason. 2K puts PC in the minority compared to consoles, so keep that in mind when you buy this game.I haven't played Seasons yet. I might give it a shot once I finish MyCareer.The PC port is playable. The framerate will dip sometimes, but it never happens during gameplay, which is a godsend. There's a good video options menu that might be confusing, but it's better than Dark Souls 1's video options by a lightyear. It also supports borderless windowed mode, which is always a massive thumbs up as it's overlooked too much. Framerates higher than 60 are supported in singleplayer, but multiplayer is locked at 60, likely for balancing reasons.Overall, I like NBA 2K17. It's a great and solid game, and I play it every day. I would recommend it.I'll write a much longer review once I complete MyCareer and play the other modes.

number of helpful: 31 of 40 people (78%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												First off, I had a very strong dislike for NBA 2K after 2K15 and 2K16. There were a myriad of issues that made me, a die hard fan of everything they did previously legitamately hate them as a company. I was overjoyed at reading Ronnie 2k's Instagram and seeing him get flamed hard by bitter fans. Watching 2k degenerate over the years made me wish EA did anything relevant at all with the Live franchise that was really good way back. And I am not a huge fan of EA either. But this game is different. I mean really different. Their are minor gripes and things that seem wrong but I don't even want to mention it for fear that an update would mess it up somehow. This game is the best basketball game I have ever played with not even a close second running behind. Remember 2K16 when a dominating rim abuser big like DeAndre Jordan or Anthony Davis would get the ball down low and for some odd reason throw a horrible lay up that missed? Yeah that's gone. Now punishing dunks as it should be and is in real life. Russell Westbrook is an incredible athlete and a pest defensively. Steph is dropping it in if he's open from almost anywhere. His layup animation isn't the same floating high ball everytime, either. It's crisp, it's fluid, I almost can't believe it's real. You can time steals. Let me say that again: YOU CAN TIME STEALS. It's not an instant foul like the previous versions. You can actually time it so that you can rip the ball during the opponents dribble. This shouldn't be a monumental achievement but somehow it feels like it is. Just from a basketball standpoint, it is the closest thing to NBA ball I have ever played on anything ever. As far as graphics go, I was recently watching the US Olympic team in 4k through a Comcast sampler. The camera angles where nice and the action was great. This actually looks a lot like that. And that looked better than any basketball coverage I had seen before. It's beautiful, it's fluid, again, it's almost unbelievable. Combined with the great realism and fun to play action, there has never been a game even close to this in terms of quality. I want to make it clear that I absolutely hated Visual Concepts before this game. I felt they had killed a great franchise. I felt that greed pushed them to forget about what made their game great. I was totally expecting this game to be a reskin of 2K16. I was disappointed when the game didn't release at midnight. I had set myself up for disappointment. Man I have never been as suprised as this and as thankful to have been wrong. This is an incredible achievement. It is the BEST BASKETBALL GAME EVER MADE FOR ANYTHING. Do I think it could be better in spots? Yes. Will I actually say anything about that? No. I am not lying in saying I am afraid right now that an update will somehow kill this game. It is that good. I would like to take a second to applaud Visual Concepts for dropping this gem on us. Man they took a lot of heat. But oh my goodness did it make this baby. And man, what a fine specimen this is. Please, please, please do not ruin this game. Please. I am a grown man. I am begging you. Do not kill this game. You have somehow birthed a masterpiece while being flamed from all sides. This is the diamond that emerged from that heat and pressure. Buy this game.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
												I guess i'll give my two cents.  Since EA refuses to create any PC games, for NBA live or Madden I appreciate 2K continuing to release a PC version.  Overall I have found the game enjoyable and would recomend the game to any NBA fan.  I especially like playing the MyCareer game mode and have spent most of my time playing it.    This is the third time I've purchased an NBA game from 2K the last one being NBA 2k12.  My PC has windows 10 and a 1080GTX card I've seen a few minor graphical gliches as well as one crash but nothing major that would cause me to regret purchasing the game.If you are someone that hasn't purchased NBA 2k in a while like myself, you will most likely be disappointed when you discover the implementation of 'Virtual Currency' better know as VC.  VC is used to buy things in the game which at first doesnt sound to bad until you realize it's tied into upgrading your player's stats.  This is a common practice in free-2-play games that introduces pay walls to get people to pay for the game.  Bascially you're paying them 'not' to play the game to skip all the boring grinding game play.  Just like any other free-2-play game they've added a varitey of ways to get small amounts of VC for free in the game, but not enough unless you plan on playing for several hours. In Mycareer they introduced player practices that allow you to do a variety of things to help unlocking upgrades as well as give small increases in attributes.  This is the grind mode of the game that you will want to skip at some point once the newness wares off.  If you want to go back and create a new player to try out the different positions and skills sets offered in the game you'll be stuck with the same routines wanting to reach for your wallet to avoid playing this part of the game.  If this was a free-2-play game I wouldn't complain to much since this is how the development team gets paid for their work. However NBA 2k17 is not a free-2-play game why is VC tied to upgrading a players attributes for a game that I've already paid for?  Cosmetic content I can see, but player attributes?  Really?  It seems like a very shady buisness practice to suck more money out of players.  Even worse gives 2K incentive to add in boring grinding pay walls that no one wants to play.  VC is not cheap either if you want to start out fully upgraded expect to fork out another $50 dollars.

Posted: April 11
												Last year I made negative review about NBA 2K16. I see the difference, this game was better than previous one. But still that is not complete game.Starting of playing my favourite mode MyCareer and mode that I have played the most. Overall not bad, offline it's fun to play, but by the half of season game seems to be repeatable and boring. No new features, no surprises - finished after winning Finals. Orange Juice - feature that didn't want me to say WOWI think archetypes are good idea for making gameplay more unique. Sharpshooters (especially big ones like 7'1) are overpowered - shooting on very high percentage, I cannot see them playing in real life. Also point forwards (6'10) are OP.I got about 6'0 so I made 6'0 shot creator. I wanted to make him lightning fast and unreacheable for Bigs. I couldn't see the speed or acceleration that huge, players 7'0 could D me easily.Despite the huge height gap I couldn't break ankles frequently with gold badges on. I didn't saw any significant advantage of playing this archetype. (moving shot was OK, but not OP like those sharpshooters 8meter bombs with hand on). Also getting Shot Creator Grand Badge until this day is unavailable for me. With other archetypes it is easier to get as many guys told me. Probably bad luck for me, should have made players with different sizes/archetypes - maybe my point of view would be different too. But simply I didn't had that much time for creating others, 2K could have made this much more balanced between many factors.Nonetheless 2K should stick to it, if they want to play basketball fans to play this mode. Also I enjoyed those badges earning them in games and getting upgrades for next level. I like that idea because you can't get over it, and you have to play those season game unless......oh well, I almost forgot. There are ton of cheaters, so if you wanted to play park/pro-am I wish you a good luck. They have 99 ovrl, unlimited different kind of badges. No security at all. Got on my nerves few times, they should be banned, so players that leaving during game without any warning, but it can cost casual player of this game 40 minutes to play with 1 random + 3 bots. There was huge delay during gameplay, but they've improved it with endless amount of patchesDon't like upgrading many attributes at one time that were unuseful for my player, like post scoring or so. Also no chance for getting your FreeThrow rating up, you could do it in practice, but it was made to vanish after couple games. BSMyTeam mode - It's looking nice and easy to collect/earn/buy players, nice card designs. But for me that's all. Getting through seeds is fun, but there are many problems with delays on shots, dribbling animations, passing. There were some situations that you could predict what's going to happen. ALSO problem connections with opponents. I had that issue so many times I couldn't keep the track on - been disconnected in 4th quarter when I was UP, rival were doing ESC and back, after few tries, sign popout that "game result of this game wouldn't be counted". AGAIN 30 minutes of playing WASTED. Many times plays are so predictible that want me to puke.TeamUp/Play online - Controlling all guys out of 5x5 games, were the best games. 10 online players in locker room and there you have - playable game with not big delay, that you actually can pullup for jumper or three. Best mode in that game to connect with other 9 players.BUT... There is Playing Online Mode and it's bad just like MyTeam, waste of time, full of predictible sets, movements, and delay.Have played some online games recently (1x1) and my opponent was killing me with Luc Richard Mbah a Boute from midrange and 3's - was swishing everything. Never saw that player been such an offensive force. I was bricking with IT and Bradley from corners though getting red realese (DELAY) BSMyLeague/MyGm - I'm not into those, won't say anything.Last year I said that I won't buy NBA 2K17, did that, after playing it for a while recommend that to friends, and that actually much better 16, still I feel guilty of cheating on myself. Huge dislike for this game/2K Crew.Second year straight I feel deluded.2K18 is not on my radar, no matter what they would put in game. I don't care about their plans about new edition.I'm done with it, you've lost your consumer, this is statement from someone that loves basketball and is big basketball fan/player.There are few more bad sides of this game, but I am so tired of it I won't put any more time into it. Also there is huge possibility I am getting PS and NBA LIVE next year.2K you made me hate your game, was playing this game since they came to the PC 2K9 year-by-year until NBA 2K17. You had your chances, and even I enjoyed some aspects of game, it wasn't a pleasure for me to participate. Time to switch to EA SPORTS. I think it's time to move on, and try something new ;)Cheers mates,Maxedit:MyTeam - already finished game, I got squad most of ruby's cards, if your opponent have higher cards, there is small chance to win this, seems like my players forgot to play after 1st good quarter, they were bricking for the rest of game, shooters like Hornacek missing wide open shots, that game is scripted BS.Play online - UNREAL - Al Horford was in front of everybody at fastbreak near 3 pt line - 1:0, somehow near paint Kyrie got him from the side, and get in the animation in front of Al. But the best thing is that Al missed this layup badly on great release, C with 6'10 missing over 6'3 PG. I know Al isn't a big dunker but come on. THAT'S ♥♥♥♥ING JOKE THAT HAPPENS FREQUENTLY. Shot meter delayed (got used to it), players missing open shots on fullbar (not green).CHANGING MY MIND - this game is not playable, THIS GAME IS ♥♥♥♥ING ANNOYING.It's so bad that 2k don't have a competitor like other company. 2k quickly would lose their clients.Unfortunately, we are forced to play virtual basketball game made by 2k. SIKE

number of helpful: 23 of 30 people (77%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
												Personally, this is not the terrible game all those bad reviews wants you to think, not at all.It's been a long time since i played a basketball videogame, I've bought all the NBA 2Ks from 2k9 to 2k12, then I just fed up and moved on for a few years. NBA 2K17 convinced me to come back, and it did a damn good job about it.This series of games is allways been full of content, it has tons of gamemodes for every type of basketball fan to enjoy.First and most important of them all: MY CAREERThis mode lets you ascend to basketball greatness through a rookie that you can create and customize to your tastes. Apparently, in the last few games they tried to add some kind of story to the mix, with some mixed result. Yes, the dialogue is kind of cringy, the cutscenes could have been better, and your mom is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥(didn't mean to offend you, sorry). But overall, i really liked it. Michael B. Jordan as your partner for a dynamic duo is a great idea and it works really well, I liked how they worked this thing in, I like how you can actually form some kind of team chemistry, which is at the core for the finest basketball. Sure I couldn't care less about my character's girlfriend, and the whole president nickname thing was just, DUMB (wait, was this related to the elections somehow? Whatever I'm not even American), but I coudln't get enough of Justice Young and of the Orange Juice, hell, even Denver is funny at times, I really cared about him being in the team. Basically, all the story aspect actually related to the sport worked really well.Attached to MyCareer there is the infamous MY PARK:I don't play it that much, but I think it's fine. You can get some entertaining games out of it, challenging other players is allways fun. There is a faction system, there are tons of events, they know how to get players to come back for more.Everyone is ♥♥♥♥♥ing about the player caps they introduced to avoid 7 foot tall basketball demigods and yes, they could have tweaked them a little bit better: some classes are more rounded than others and can handle more things better.Personally I play in the park with an undersized 5.8 ft slasher point guard, witch is probably the worst build ever, but I'm totally fine with it. This was the closest from my real life playstyle of basketball, so just like in real life I put all my skills into play, and just like in real life I win sometimes, I get kicked in the♥♥♥♥♥other times.Another mode is MYGM/MYLEAGUE:In this mode you can choose to play as an entire NBA franchise, with whatever play style you want.If you either want to be a manager, be a coach, or just send your favourite team to a 82-0 record win streak, you can do that in this mode.Me? Well I'm too late to give Kobe a 6th ring, so I'll just give Derrick Rose his first one (♥♥♥♥ing love D-Rose man).Another fun thing to do here is just to simulate up to 2070s and see how the NBA has evolved, who won what and all that stuff. It can be a nice experiment for a couple of hours.Then there's MYTEAM:I don't have much to tell about this mode because i barely played it so far, I might update. Basically, you just create and customize a team, you can give it a name, a logo, a stadium, customize the jerseys, hire the players.But, you do all of that, by collecting cards. I don't like collecting cards so, whatever.The last one i can think of is PLAY NOW:You can just set up a quick game offline against the CPU or a friend, or a long♥♥♥♥♥online game, witch is going to take forever because nobody is playing this ♥♥♥♥ing mode. Maybe because it lags, a lot. My park is full of players and it doesn't lag nearly as much, what the hell.Honorable mention to the soundtrack, I really appreciated it. Finally some diversity, different genres instead of the same "yo-yo i'm playing basketball homie!", which was fun when i pretended to be black (was that racist? I think it was racist). The tracks are really up beat, which I really like, some tracks are not even in English (German singing is pretty cool) and there's Imagine Dragons, IMAGINE DRAGONS! Believe it or not this was the reason I decided to come back to NBA 2K.  I love Imagine Dragons!Overall, is really solid and enjoyable. The wrongest thing that you could tell about this game is that it is not worth the money: sports games are probably the best dials you'll find from a videogame point of views, the amount of content this game has is incredible. You could spend dozens if not hundreds of hours in a single gamemode without getting tired of it.Being a sport game though brings a big flaw to the package, which is why this game is being teared apart: It's an yearly release. That means that the developers don't have time to fix the problems this game has, they're already working on the next one. And trust me, this game has some flaws, I didn't mentioned that many because my review is already long as it is, and the other reviews, made by the fans who buy this game every year, are a lot better than me at pointing the flaws.But a fan can ♥♥♥♥♥ at both actual problems and changes to the formula, they might not like those changes, but they're stuck with them until the next game comes out, which might not even resolve the problem they had to begin with.I can understand that, but for me it's not a good reason to be so butthurt, that's just childish. If you're tired of the game, just don't buy the next one for a while, just like I did. I came back now and I'm liking the same thing you're hating so much.So, in the end, because this is taking long enough, if you're a fan of the series and you're considering this game, or the next one, who knows, consider both what are the innovations and what are the flaws, if It's not worth it for you, just skip it and wait until you're going to miss this beautiful sport. In the meantime, you might want to try it in real life.

Posted: September 26, 2016
												! have quickly developed a love/hate relationship with this game.Pros-No freeqin and vibin in MyCarreer-Most game modes have been expanded upon rather than changed (especially MyGM)-Gameplay feels a bit more realistic, but still has some major flaws (see Cons)-Nice soundtrack (in my opinion)Cons-Attribute caps in MyCarreer are ridiculous! There is no way to become a "special" player, and that takes a lot away from the immersion of the mode. Meanwhile, the cheaters will be even better, compared to the honest players.-The mode is a huge grindfest. Unless, of course, you are willing to pay some extra, say, 20-40 bucks. Prepare for dozens of hours of grinding for VC and badges, before you can even consider playing competitively online with your MyPlayer-Jumpshots feel...strange. I don't know, it must be me, since I don't see too many people complaining about them, but this is the first iteration of the game in which I can't make jumpshots at a consistent rate. I have accumulated thousands of hours in various NBA 2K games across multiple platforms, but this one makes me throw my gamepad at the wall-Layups! You got to be ♥♥♥♥ing kidding me! A shot meter for layups? Making those in traffic is an impossible task for me, since the perfect release seems to be super early, much earlier than in previous games. -AI is totally overpowered on All-Star and up. Plus, all your AI-controlled teammates become super dumb-Although there are less bugs than last year (and a lot of legacy bugs have been fixed, for example the commentary just cutting out for half a quarter), there are new bugs that are much more gamebraking. Invisible arms and invisible menus (which require a complete restart of the computer to resolve). Plus: green faces!Some little nitpicking:-Too many injuries in MyGM- tbcVerdict: I'm a noob and should go play something else

content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
												I recommend to buy this game for any NBA fan, but, there is a lot of problems.Graphically it's more or less the same than NBA 2k16, meaning ok but nothing amazing for today games.Problem number one though, even if the graphics are about the same, the framerate is two time worse, I do have to say that I did play this one on Windows 10 while I played the last one on Win7 so this might be because od Windows.Speaking of graphics, they need to take serious course on anatomy at 2k studio, yes the scanned faces are allright, yes some players really look good, but some others just look laughable, wrong body type, terrible proportion on some part of the body (in particular the whole shoulders and neck area) Gameplay wise, it's the best NBA 2k I played so far (I only played 2k14,15,16 before though)Myteam feels better than before, more rewarding, the current cards are lower on ratings on purpose to allow a longer lifespan, which is not a terrible idea even if it can feel cheap.The MyGm/MyLeague mode are refined from last year, overall they do feel better, and the league extension is a really good idea.MyCareer mode is allright so far, there is some really decent VC rewards from sponsors to be gained along the way which again make the whole mode more rewarding, the big problem is that you can't skip cutscenes! Yes The cutscenes (that are for 95% of them not worth anyone time to be honest) are forced on you, if you plan to only do one myplayer it can be ok, but if you plan on testing several archetype then you are up for at least 30 minutes of unskippable cutscenes in the first 2 hours of the game more or less, which is boring.Archetypes and the skill caps that come with them are another issue, as many have pointed out, it's almost impossible to create a real superstar player stat wise, but it has to be balanced with the gameplay that is improved and allow more freedom than before, so you will still be able to pull amazing moves even with less impressive stats.

number of helpful: 14 of 17 people (82%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												For the people who don't like reading long reviews here is a quick overview for you.Is it better than 2K16? YES!Is it just another sports game reskin? NO! This game feels fresh and brand new. A breath of fresh air.Should I purchase it? Yes. Its the best 2K sports game period in my opinion.Rating : 8.5/10 (will be a 9/10 once a flew bugs get fixed)OK. Now into the real reviewWe all love 2K right thats why you are here reading this correct? The  main questions alot of us ask ourselves is... Is this game better than the last game/ is it a major update worth paying 60$ for.. My answer is yes here is why.PROS1) The game overall presentation is amazing. You get sucked into the game as soon as it launches, everything feels refreshed. I haven't seen a sports game presentation this good since ESPN  NFL 2K5.2) The variety of animations make the game feel revamped and refreshing, something 2K has been needing for quite some time now.3) The Steal System/Defense mechanics are on par and feel great to use. The new system also disable the steal spammers from 2K16 it actually requires some skill to use.4) My Career so far is amazing. The whole setup in my opinion is awesome. The smart phone integration is pretty dope as well5) (Depending On Your GPU) The load times are way faster this time. So no more long long long long mypark loading screens.6) The character models look great. 7) The game is fun as hell, balanced, & fun to experience offline or online.8) MyTeam is amazing as well this year, the pack odds seem to be increased due to even higher level cards such as the return of Ruby & Onyx from 2K15.9) The shooting system/layup system is easy to get use to.10) Tons of new features which are actually fun to play/use.11) The HUGE selection of shoes, all the shoes are highly detailed this year. 12) The AI isn't dumb this year, you actually feel challenge. If you are making alot of shots expects double teams and the AI reacting aggresive towards  you which is very realistic.13) Last but not least the soundtrack is AMAZING! Alot of classics songs. I usually get bored with video game soundtracks but this soundtrack for 2K17 is amazing even better than 2K13.Cons1)Bugs that need to be patched. (fast playing custscenes & disappearing limbs time to time)2) Face scan app is GARBAGE!Final VerdictDespite semi flaws, none of them tarnish the game-play nor the game itself. The game is amazing to play, plus a quick patch could fix those little errors. If you are a 2K Gamer this 2K is a MUST HAVE! 9/10 once bugs are fix but 8.5/10 for now.

content:
Posted: January 3
												NBA 2K17,I clocked 250+ hours into this game so I think its time for a review of this game.Singleplayer:Playnow:What can I say about it nothing new, blacktop is great if you play a player they dont have their jerseys, you have a crowd. And the place its set up is actually awesome.Mycareer: Mycareer changed alot it now features Archetypes (NBA 2K17 biggest and only feature) It looked good at the trailer but I actually realised thats its bad real bad. Lets say I want to be glasscleaner eating boards, but I also want to shoot - NOPE you can't do that you cant be Demarcus Cousins or any of the great NBA centers/powerforwards. Cause I'm sure there are Shooting centers that grab rebounds, but 2K placed a cap on this so you cant shoot very well. Oh yeah, myplayer still sounds black, for the people that have problems with it, its perfectly fine for me. The Myplayer creation ugh, its AWFUL nothing new! No new haircuts but THEY gave the NBA players their good haircuts lets say Jimmy Butler, he got his haircut really good at this game but they dont have an option for us to wear it. The Story is good, why good you say? Cause its better then 2K16's. MyLeague/MyGM:This was the gamemode where I didnt find any bugs/glitches, MyGM and Myleague(Online) is still there you also have ''Start Today'' where you play as your favourite NBA team and start where the team left off with all real NBA stats, standings and injuries. you also have ''Season'' where you just play one season and ''playoff) where you play in the playoffs. They also have this new thing called ''League Expansion'' with that you can start the league with the 30 current NBA teams and have 6 extra teams! (Awesome), You can then create your own team or use a pre-built team or Download it. content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												So this game is no 2k10-13 (these were the best 2K games IMO). But I must say that compared to the last 3 years of the same game being recycled with updated rosters and graphics, and that horrid Joint with Spike, 2K didn't do a bad job on this one. The game mechanics for the most part feel very fluid and natural, and the enviornments are improved to feel more alive. MyCareer is a huge improvement to the last 2 years, although it lacks much of a story line, you actually feel like a pro with continuous visits and texts from teammates, your best friend Justice(Michael B. Jordan), coaches, and players around the league. In addition, you have to make certain decisions with you endorsements, and they feel pretty rewarding and something to work towards. WARNING: The difficulty of this game has been increased. It can be frustrating as you have to link dribble moves together to be effective. It is much harder to break ankles and get space for shots, and now you actually have to adapt to the game and read defensive schemes. But when you do make a great play and that time that you actually do blow by a defender it feels extremely gratifying. All-In-All I recommend this game to any fan of basketball as it truly is a step-up from recent years of 2K and offers a challenge as well as entertainment.*UPDATE*: I originally got the game for the love of basketball and something to kill time. 10 days after recieving it I have now realized how week of a community this game has. It is nothing against anybody playing this game (except hackers), but I wanted this game for the occasional "turn on my computer between classes, play a quick my team matchmaking game or mypark to show off my roster or progress respectively, then turn it off". The thing is, I end up in empty My Parks and find myself waisting 5-10 minutes hoping to find an Online My Team Match with absolutely no luck... I love the game but wish the online community was even a 1/4 as strong as consoles (especially cause of how many community threads have been created). Oh, and have had no luck finding Play Now games or My Team Blacktop. Severely dissapointed I paid full price to have no Online community. Only recommend it because of what I stated above and if by some miniscule chance enough people get it, I might actually start seeing people Online.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2016
												I would say that I have decidedly mixed feelings about this game. There are times when it's a lot of fun, but those moments are, ultimately, overshadowed by the game's more frustrating aspects. The Good:The game's franchise mode, "MyGM," has a lot of depth to it, and compares favorably with the franchise modes in most other sports games. Within MyGM, there are a lot of options for different ways to simulate games, including several that allow you to partially sim a game, jumping in and out of the action as needed. This is something that is overlooked in a lot of other sports games, and it goes a long way towards making it possible to actually get a lot out of the franchise mode without having to put in more time than you really want to. The graphics are very good, though that comes with the significant caveat that even on very high-end computers, the framerate becomes unacceptable unless you turn the graphics settings way down. But even on the lower graphics settings that you end up playing on, the game still looks great.The coaching options within games are great. I love the ability to give my team instructions during timeouts and it doesn't take very long to get used to navigating the different coaching menus that are available during the game, during timeouts, and when you pause the game. Having a bunch of classic NBA teams, as well as international clubs, is a really nice touch. The "rubberbanding" seems to have been significantly reduced this year, if not elimated altogether. This was probably single biggest improvement the game needed to make, so I'll definitely give props to the devs for that!The presentation is very good. The menus look good and are easy to navigate, load times are quick, and the soundtrack is excellent. Areas for improvement: 1) the lineup annoucements at the start of the game feel very stiff and robotic. Each name, position, etc. is read off in exactly the same way, with the same intonation, spacing, volume... even the crowd's cheering is the exact same for every player. 2) While the soundtrack is, again, excellent, the over-the-top censoring of the lyrics is super annoying. Either choose songs that aren't explicit, or don't censor them. Cutting out every other word of a song (including words like "thugs", "steal", and "E") is just obnoxious. The Bad:Too many actions are mapped to the same controller input, or an input similar enough that you're likely to do the wrong one by mistake. The game relies heavy on contextual actions, with the computer deciding what it thinks you meant to do based on the situation. Unfortunately, artificial intelligence isn't yet where it needs to be in order for this sort of system to work smoothly. It works pretty well most of the time, but there are reasonably frequent instances of "I wanted to do a layup, not a jumper!", or "I wanted to do a hesitation dribble, not a shot!", etc.No option to turn off the pregame show, halftime show, or--most annoyingly--the in-game infographics. Sometimes the game will be interrupted for 20 seconds while they show a stupid pie chart with some stat I don't care about, and I have to wait for it to go away before I can continue playing the game. The shameless advertisements for Gatorade. "You know, Kenny, one really underrated advantage to timeouts is that it gives the players a chance to get some Gatorade. It's so important to stay hydrated, and these players aren't going to play as well late in the game if they don't take the time to replenish their electrolytes during the timeout. They need to refuel with Gatorade in order to play their best." "I couldn't agree more."The commentary. It's not necessarily worse than other sports games, but the gaming industry as a whole just hasn't made the kind of investment into good commentary that it needs to. One specific shortcoming is that the commentary seems to be triggered by the outcome of a play, rather than how it actually went down. A player might shoot a ridiculous falling-out-of-bounds three-pointer just over the fingertips of the defender, and they'll say "How could they leave him so wide-open?! That's just lazy defending." But if a wide-open shot is missed, they might say "great defending on that play! they made sure to get a hand in his face and force a bad shot."The game is heavily lacking in the realm of instructions. There are a lot of game mechanics--including even the controls themselves--that aren't explained in enough detail, or aren't explained at all. I've had to do way too much googling to try and figure out how different parts of this game work--and in many cases, I haven't been able to find an answer at all. The Ugly:The coins/microtransactions system seems to pervade every inch of the game, and it feels like every design decision was made with the microtransactions system in mind. For example, in MyGM, there's no ability to save your game or load an old save. The game autosaves frequently, and that's the only save you can use. I even tried copying off the save file (in my filesystem, outside of the game) and loading it back in later (without modifying it at all), only to have the game throw an error that the file was "invalid" or "corrupted" or something like that. Presumably, this is to stop people from somehow exploiting saves to get coins, or something stupid like that. But as someone who couldn't care less about the stupid coins, it's just annoying. If I want to reload my save if I lose a game, I should be able to--it's my freaking game. Similarly, there's no ability to turn off injuries once you've started a franchise. So, you can be 10 years into your franchise and decide that you're tired of dealing with player injuries, and your only choice would be to start over from scratch, with injuries turned off. Again, this is presumably to stop people from turning off injuries instead of paying coins to heal their players. Every mode of the game is completely oriented around the coins system. In the MyGM mode, for example, you spend coins to improve your franchise, to keep your players happy, to scout opposing teams, to keep your players healthy, to improve your chances of signing players, to improve team chemistry, and so on. Passing. The passing is absolutely, inexcusably terrible. It's beyond frustrating, and you'll find yourself passing to the wrong person more often than not. And for those people who counter by saying "you should use icon passing," the fact is that icon passing is too slow, not an option in many cases (like when you're already in mid-air), and not a good excuse for the lack of basic functionality. The fact is that they've dedicated three buttons on the controller just to basic passing (not even counting icon passing, or the double-press or long-press inputs)--and none of them work well enough. The passing controls in this game sound fancy and elaborate, but that doesn't mean a thing if you can't quickly and reliably choose which player to pass to. No physics system, or a very bare-bones physics system. The game does not appear to utilize a physics system. Instead, the game seems to rely on preset actions and animations. For example, you can lliterally run circles around a ballhandler while they stand still at the top of the key, dribbling, and it is not possible to run into the ball or knock it away. The only way to steal the ball is to press the input for "steal", at which point the game will do some calculation to determine whether you knock the ball away, commit a foul, or just swipe and miss. No out-of-bounds forcefield. Players will happily sprint headlong out of bounds, which is a problem because staying in bounds ends up demanding a level of precision that we simply don't have with our combination of controller + camera angle. As a result, baseline drives are all-but-nonexistant.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												A little more the same but some additions which i personally do not like. It's decent but not incredibly compelling. I cannot say I would recommend it and having bought every single nba2k game since 2k9 (when it came to pc), I find myself seriously considering whether or not to get the next one. Do note that most of these comments are directed at mostly single-player MyCareer gameplay which is the feature I found/find most compelling and fun. It's not intended to apply to online multi-player play which I do not do enough of to form any informed opinion. A big sour-note for some time from the series is how MyCareer has pretty much become you playing out a story written by someone else. While some of the stories have been interesting most of them are cliched and pigeon-hole you into some one's idea of what a baller should be. If there is going to be a story about my career, I would want MyCareer to be my story and one that I can choose for myself - not live out someone else's fantasy. In many ways. the older MyCareer without so much story-mode was so much more open and dynamic. With the last few iterations, it's always the same old story - high school phenom, such a nice person, yada yada yada. At least, the story a few iterations back (about not being drafted and having to work to find a team) was compelling (and also fit the starting stats they gave you). The recent ones including this one have literally all been such a drag. Which brings me to my first comment: -1. You can't skip the cut-scenes! If I wanted to watch a movie, I'd watch a movie. I just want to play. Granted that some may enjoy these but I'm sure there are many like me who don't. Just give us the choice to skip through the cut-scenes at least after the first play through! Sometimes I like to re-roll a player, I like having different permutations/builds and players in different positions. Sitting through 3-5 minutes of cut-scenes every 6 minutes is terrible. 2. Not sure what they did to the movement/running mechanics but controlling a player feels like he's running on ice or has his feel stuck to the ground. The addition of momentum/inertia et al is well and good, but i figure that if a player is playing a college level (much less NBA-level), he should generally be able to run where he wants to. 3. A crap-load of illegal moving screens by the pc. Last instalment got too whistle-happy with the illegal screens, this one seems to forget it all together. 4. Not sure I like starting out MyPlayer pigeon-holed with the archtypes they think are appropriate. For once, I would be able to like to choose some starting skills/badges instead of being pigeon-holed. The whole best player in high school/lottery pick but starting out at 55 player rating is getting old. Either do away with the super baller rheotoric or do the stats some justice. 5. The practice routines start out ok, but become a serious grind after a while. The routines also need to be more varied and positional. It's ridiculous to expect a PF/C to go one-on-one with a star guard or take threes all the time. That said, after you've been playing for a while, it can get incredibly monotonous which while perhaps realistic is not the quite of simulation 2k was hoping for. 6. While the concept of having a buddy on court sounds great, I'm not too thrilled with the whole Justice Young thing. Firstly, this guy who supposedly couldn't even break into the 1st round draft because 'teams were put off by his size' comes out from the blocks having an 89-rating (my player got drafted by the Raptors, Kyle Lowry's a 88, this MBJ-clone is an 89 ... so much for immersion and credibility). Game-breaking much? Secondly, this developer-created guy is taking valuable minutes from legit real-life players. There's really only room for ONE imaginary player in MyCareer. Would have been more interesting if they made you earn the buddy with chemistry or something else with an existing player.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												Much Better.We are all familiar with the 2k series and 2k17 aimed to improve many of the aspects of the previous titles.NBA 2K17 is a huge improvement over the previous titles.Lets start with the bad.Still some issues with movement and direction. The controlled character may get stuck at times with bad collision with other players. (i have to give 2kprops this was a huge problem in the last title, that is now a minor one).Unskippable cut scenes.The long standing issue of being penalized in team rank score, for playing help defense is a long standing issue that has been in many titles.The AI likes to pass you the ball when you run close to them which creates congestion.The AI needs to better determine when you are open. (its acceptable, not great.)The good.The acting has bee vastly improved.It also seems like someone with a brain wrote the script (they appropriately avoid stereotypes and is appropriate no matter how you created your custom character.)SHOOTING NOW MAKES SENSE! Finally a shot percentage system that is more reliant on making plays and skill.The graphics, especially they realistic movements.Honestly there are so many mechanics that have been vastly improved its not useful to go into them.What you need to know is that 2k is finally on the mend from 16 and 15.
