content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												The last sports game I have played before this one, was NFL2k1 on Dreamcast.I bought this game mostly for MyCareer, and I loved Michael B. Jordan in CREED.Visuals and Gameplay:Playing on an 'old' cpu i7 2600k with a decent GFX card, a GTX 970 on max settings with 4x anti-aliasing, the game looks great and plays very smoothly with a 360 gamepad. Even though I did not play a sports game in the last few years (15) I picked-up the control easily, and I love how easy it can be at first and then realize you can do much more than you thought, I love the mechanics, though not always easy, the learning curve is not too bad for a noob like me.MyCareer:About 10 hours in MyCareer, I chose Georgia Tech as my starting team and was drafted 11th in the first round by Orlando's Magic. The dynamic duo thing is going on and the story is quite fun so far.Face Scan:Not so easy to do at first, but once you get it, the result is quite, well, creepy and spectacular, I was tired when I took the pictures and my avatar looks always stoned in-game, but that's a lot of fun to watch, very enjoyable.I did not play the other MyWhatever so far, I intend to do so once I get tired of MyCareer, but so far it's quite fun, except maybe all that training :)8/10

number of helpful: 18 of 33 people (55%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 1, 2016
												**This review is based solely on my experience from MyCareer**TL;DR: The MyCareer experience is a solid 10/10.When you start your MyCareer for the very first time, you quickly realize, this "ain't no Spike Lee joint", but that's probably the best part of the story during your first season of your career. Without spoiling too much I can reveal that you're given two friends in the NBA (Justice and Denver) who will accompany you on your journey. These two are by far the best thing 2K have come up with as they are extremely well thoughtout characters, and the actor behind Justice, Michael B Jordan if I'm not mistaken, known from TV does an extremely good job at portraying your best friend. Put in contrast to 2k16, where Vic was supposed to be your best friend, the characters in 2k17 are actually likeable. Besides that, the story is well ridden and you get more "off court time" as you attend practices and endorsements/meetups, the latter being rabbitholes, but for "roleplaying" it's still nice. You get to actually play in college this year, although it is only for four or five games. Personally I would've loved to have played more in college, although I know other players hated the college experience. In the future I hope we get a chance to pick our starting conditions. i.e., do we want to play the college experience or 2k15's version where you are undrafted, and that way get a chance to pick who you play for (to some degree)Now to the actual gameplay. The gameplay this year feels much smoother than previous games. Your teammates are actually smart and will make plays and are more likely to shoot if they are open (no more 2k15 hugging of the ball when they are completely open). Defense play seems much smoother and thusly easier and the greatest change is the AI's better understanding of pick'n'roll plays, where you can with fewer button hits and thusly much faster tell them to screen for you and go to the basket for your easy assist. Final Judgement:If you're thinking about getting this game primarily for the MyCareer experience I can only strongly suggest that you do, as I rate this year's MyCareer a solid 10/10. You really feel part of the team, although the people who make you feel this way aren't on the actual team. The friendship you build are well written and the cutscenes make you want more. **A few bugs have happened for me though primarily the "no cutscenes bug" where you will go your first 10-13 games without getting cutscenes with Justice. **

content:
Posted: April 20
												This game is judged very harshly on steam.  I completely understand why there are negative reviews if cheating is an issue in many of the online modes though, and that is something that needs to be fixed moving forward.However......I am somehwat of an old school sports gamer, setting up my Franchise and playing in offline modes with my drafted team, and being the GM.  Or playing against friends locally in our own fantasy seasons.  For doing anything offline, I can definitively say that this is the best basketball, and probably sports game i've ever played.  On PC it looks absolutely fantastic. I own it on both Xbone and PC and there is a staggering difference in visual quality and fluidity of play.  Not to mention the load times are practically non existent compared to the Xbone.  I sincerely hope some of the issues that are plagueing this game for so many get resolved.  Because at it's core, this game is a remarkable accomplishment.  It's awesome to see the difference a high-end PC makes on a title I have always played on consoles.

Posted: January 28
												I love sports and Basketball. I have been playing NBA 2k since dreamcast. I dont have a problem with the game itself because I think the game is amazing and gets better ever year. My issues with the game Overall and why I give it a thumbs down is because of the "pay to play/Pay to Win" side of the game.Ever Since they added in VC its started to take the fun out of it for me. I understand its a currency that is in the game you dont have to buy and thats an option, they do have many ways to get it for free like: the @k tv quizes and events etc. But everyone wants to be good, its a sport! but when it starts to feel like the only way to have fun is too pay 40 bucks to get your player on level with others....I lke the MYPark and the MyCareer. The MyCareer mode is where i live, and in this game your rival "Justice Young" is a rookie with a rating of 85-89 depending on your MyPlayer. When you create a MyPlayer your rating is under 70, almost all the actually rookies drafted in the first round are above 74 with the top 3 mostly being 79-82. To me it feels like they want you to spend money day 1, then enjoy the game...I have no hate towards 2K or the staff I just dont like how the micro transactions are a major impact on the game and now that they are getting into Esports making a MyPlayer to be the way I actually want him to be doesnt work. Now the game feels super restricting. Thats my opinon, im not having fun with the way the game is this year. I do Love many of the features added that i hope they keep moving forward.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												NBA 2k17 is the newest basketball game in the long running series by Visual Concepts.There are several modes and something for mostly everyone who enjoys basketball. Such as MyCareer, an RPG mode where you play as a highly touted and scouted rookie who can barely dribble a basketball, who somehow winds up in the NBA. It's a real feel good story. In MyGM mode you can manage your own team, while other GMs try to screw you over every chance they get. Don't worry, you can take your frustrations out on your loyal fans, and gouge them for everything; ticket prices, parking, even refreshments! A true to life basketball business simulation.Or you can play online against other players in various modes, everyone will have mostly the same experience as the netcode hasn't been touched since the Dreamcast version of the series.Overall, NBA 2K17 is the best basketball game on Earth, mostly by default. Also gamers, don't forget to fuel up with Gatorade™ and MTNDew™, since the game will remind you every chance it gets.

												Everything that 2K16 had was taken to the next level, specially the s**** Spike Lee joint. The gameplay feels way smoother and dependant on player skill instead of being animation based (post moves and crossovers are smooth as ♥♥♥♥ man), the graphics are fine, new animations bring a fresh feel to the game (love the crowd enthusiasm during the game too) and basically everything just clicks together nicely.MyPlayer is way superior than the last year: -Narrative is way better (♥♥♥♥ you Spike Lee)-You can play the whole Rookie Year again-The off-days are better designed, with various activities on your disposal instead of having one activity take a whole day off.-More choices and RPG'ish feelAlso, no crashes or game freezing bugs so far, runs like a charm and the load times are faster too!Overall I'm very happy with my purchase and I will play this game for a long time, probably more than 2K16 since the gameplay is much more enjoyable.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2016
												NBA 2K17 Review :(Based on my experience so far in the game)Pros or the things that i like :- First off this year 2K17 is huge improvement from last year, all what you hear are mostly right, the gameplay are much smoother, the way you handle the ball is really felt amazing,  doing dribble moves crossover here and there breaking ankles. - The layup meter is actually not bad even though you have to get used to it first. - Difficulty Hall of Fame this year finally doesn't feel like in 2K16 where your opponent is unreal, this time it's hard but it's fair, i really enjoyed playing in HoF, great challenge to test your skill. But if it's your first time try from Pro then work your way up. - MyCareer and MyLeague are also huge improvement (these are the main reason i am buying this game)- In MyCareer great story line. Where else did you get a sport game with great story? It's a huge plus, it felt like an RPSG (Role Playing Sport Game). the caps are really strict but personally i like it, but it could be improved. - In MyLeague you can start with additional teams and start from off season so you can fix whatever your favorite team doing wrong this off season(yes i am looking at you lakers)Cons or things i dislike and needed to be fixed immidiately :- Start with gameplay, broken defense. Okay sometimes my guy just leave his assignment even though i don't need help on defense. and that mooving screeen (it's not technically a screen, but it feels like you just being pushed by your opponent) it is totally needed to be fixed. even though sometimes you can use it to your advantage to get open shot, but still it's a broken defense- The cap, yes i like it but it's very strict and could be improved like after practice that cap upgrade not only it upgraded the overal cap of the upgrade we can buy, but also the max level of that upgrade path.Ex : like in the shooting 3pt path i can only upgrade until level 15, after practice and filling those doing work bar and level up, it could be used to increase the max level to level 16 3pt. Overall :Yes I love this game, but i hope patches are coming in the future to fix this. I know 2K worked hard on this to be a perfect basketball game. but until i get these problem fixed i give this game 8/10PS : I am not really interested in myTeam but it's pretty good, collecting cards, doing challenge playing game online, but you need serious vc if you want your team to be good fast, and i am not really a fan of that.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2016
												7/10It would be a 10 out of 10 but the game has some pretty annoying cons that 2K would have to consider fixing!Overall a great game! But.....Pros:- Gameplay is solid. Very good work done here. Everything runs flawlessly in-game. Graphics are pretty good, movement of players and with or without ball seems real, shot animations and animations in general work smoothly and appear real on eye.- Game atmosphere it's fantastic! Fans graphocs and animations are awesome and even a friend of mine when I sent him a video of a buzzer beater I've managed, he didn't realized this was a game but thought this happened IRL.- MyCareer story is good, although replacing two players IRL with two new (Justice Young and Denver Levins) is somewhat not ideal.  It would prefferable for 2K to have given them another role in-game.- MyGM mode has not changed a lot, at least until the part I've managed to reach(still mid-season). Good thing they still let you choose the roster. Cause I did some edits I wanted.Cons:- MyCareer roster! 2K should let you choose an edited roster like on MyGM mode.- !!!!!!  MyCareer system of upgrading your player is pretty much annoying!!!! Forcing you to buy extra VC if you want to quickly update your player. Even participating in all practices all you gain is extra upgrade points and no free attributes gain. If you want to increase your attributes you'll have to pay. I may understand that putting player stats on the server side and forcing you to buy upgrades with VC is to catch cheaters on myPark mode but I think that MyCareer player and MyPark player has to be seperated! Or at least give you a chance to choose so when you start your Career.-1,5 for this  on overall score- MyGM mode had from previous year the "Relocation" option. Well this was a good feature that needed improvents and none made. To the point. The game let's you stay on the same city and not even rename the organization. That's pretty awesome!But the game does not let you finish tha application without alternating your court and jerseys. Why? All I want is just to upgrade my arena's features to have a more attendance and game revenue. I don't want to change either my team's jerseys or the court design.  For example I have Bucks! I like their current uniforms and court desings(they have two different). I don't want to change them. But game does not let you complete the relocation application.-1,5 for this too.So overall score is 7/10 for only two cons in the game. But these are so annoying that leave a bitter taste at the end.

content:
Posted: October 2, 2016
												After almost 50 hours with NBA 2K17 I can say it is a superior basketball game to it's predecessor - 2K16. You won't see the improvements on video footage since graphics are pretty much the same (except sweat and players body types) but as with the gameplay improvements - they are there.First of all, when you play your first game you realise how much more fluid the controls over players feel. Slower players are finally not totally useless as even they can contribute to the score not only by attempting 3 point shots but also SUCCEFULLY driving to the basket. Yes, attacking the basket off the dribble actually makes sense this year and yet it's not really easier. New thing with this game is that you have to time your every shot - including layups, floaters, post hooks and shots under the basket. It's difficult to get a hang of at first but later you can appreciate this addition as every "green release" goes in - yeah, NO MATTER WHAT. Shot meter this year is different too and it seems that timing the shot perfectly is a lot harder. As I mentioned before - controls are fluid, there is almost no imput lag (in offline games) and you can go from one crossover move to the other without your player bumping into the defender and being stuck in the animation afterwards. Crossing people and getting by them is a lot of fun and isolation plays make sense.What do I hate? Getting stuck on the moving screen and ending up 10 feet from the opposite team's player which happens constantly and some funky elements of MyCareer mode within its plot. It's far better than last year (10-minutes cutscenes are gone, HELL YEAH) with pretty interesting role of Michael B. Jordan playing Justice Young - an NBA prospect coming to the league undrafted which becomes your teammate and your best friend as well. The chemistry between your MyPlayer and Justice is pretty believable and not-so-in-your-face as with Vic in NBA 2K16. Playing a game with him on the floor is a lot of fun, too.There is a subject of face-scan for MyPlayer as well. I'm absolutely happy that it has finally arived on PC version but there aren't any more positives that come to my mind. It's a horrible process, horrible companion app for Android/iOS, just horrible overall. If you are not keen on that function coming into the game - don't even try it, because you will find yourself wasting HOURS on trying to get any decent scan that doesn't make your nose appear on your chin. You'll probably check it anyway so I won't bother spending any more time on it - it seems that creators were thinking the same. yuck.So overall, if you are a fan of both NBA and NBA 2k games there is no reason not to buy this year rendition of this franchise. There are a lot of neccesary improvements from previous game which makes me almost sure that I'll beat my time from NBA 2k16 at 508 hours in-game. Think no longer - get it!

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
 This game should have been released in Steam Early Access for half price since it clearly doesn't play like a finished game. Too many CRASHES & BUGS to count! Crashes frequently on PC just like in 2K16 & 2K15! These games never crash in-game but just randomly in the menus of the various game modes. Every year I repeat the same stupid mistake of buying the new 2K basketball game thinking they will fix the crashing issues, THEY DON'T! I have a laptop and an extremely high-end PC I play on, as well as my brother who plays on a third computer. Every year all three of our computers randomly crash while  trying  to play this game. Therefore this is completely an issue of the game and not the computers! On top of all that this game runs like complete garbage on my PC running SLI 980 TI's. It runs even worse than last years game. The hair on players is transparent and there are many more bugs & glitches in-game. If 2K seriously cared about releasing a quality game, they would not only have fixed the problems that have plagued this franchise in years past, but would have correctly patched the previous games as well (as none of their patches fixed any of the crashing and still left many bugs). If I play MyLeague for an hour or two, I experience crashes to the desktop 2 or 3 times  minimum. It's as if these developers and testers didn't play the game at all before they released it.2K please offer me a job, my input alone is worth more than you pay these idiots to make this game. ATTN ALL PC GAME PUBLISHERS: When you resort to only releasing console games, don't blame the lack of PC sales on pirates when your abysmal games are not worth paying for!

content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												So this is a pre-release review with every intention of a follow up. For the most part it is a negative review.Cons:1) PC Disadvantage:-Pre-Release content. I heard that consoles were able to get the game a week in advance with just high school content. This enabled players to build the character up prior to the actual game. Unfortunately PC players didn’t get that option. Also Iv read that some people haven’t gotten any bonuses.-Graphics. Because the PC version is a port from the consoles, there is a big difference in performance. When playing on consoles, graphics are set; however when starting the graphics need to be tweaked. For those sporting a 1070+ graphics cards Iv read that they have been doing fine. I read a review where a person with a 970 sli was struggling. For majority of the people it is going to be like this: lower your graphics to get a faster gameplay, or increase your graphics to what you feel was acceptable by nba2k16 and experience a very laggy gameplay. I’m running a gtx970m, had no problems with the previous games on max settings but am struggling here. The voice acting in the cutscenes finish way ahead than the actual laggy video.2) Initial Story:-How can the personality of the character be so arrogant and pompous with the level designated to him. Jeez even number 1 draft picks in the game are given like a 78 or 79. Also why can’t we skip initial cutscenes?Pros:1) More options?-A lot more options are provided but I haven’t experienced them all. For instance, you can add 6 new teams into your mygm mode. Will add more with a follow up.Neutral1) Face Scan-Mix reviews about this. One would think that capturing a face scan on a cellphone would make things easier (because of the higher megapixels etc) but it is still challenging. Some people are able to get it with little effort while others struggle. Hence this feature is pretty neutral.Will be waiting for an update/patch for the game to answer the graphical issues. It sucks because pre-ordering it gives people the opportunity to play the game 4 days in advance. This graphical issue negates that advantage because playing on lowered settings spoils the experience for the user, while they have to wait for a patch. Right of the the Bat: console versions definitely better option. For the recommendation portion: If people pre-ordered this and got a discount on the price, then thats your advantage. However, if people paid full price with the option of playing earlier, then I don't recommend it. If you are like the majority where NBA 2k16 was running smoothly, there is a high chance it won't for the inital part of the game till after an update is released (which may come in a week or 2).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 4, 2016
												A massive step backward from 2k16 which was already a shaky game. Do Not play against the A.I. though, stick to pvp as it is much more balanced. The game is designed to be challenging but it reaches a certain point (especially in MyCareer) when the game has to make you worse in order to keep up. Which is complete and utter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. There were countless times where players I was defending literally glitched through me and made shots. I created a guy that had his shooting stats maxed out, I spent hours perfecting the timing on his shot. Yet, even if I played a game where all I took was wide-open shots, I would probably end up shooting 30-40% which is nonsense. The only time I felt my player shot a decent percentage we end up blowing out teams by 60 pts. so I turn the difficulty up hoping to balance it out. Wrong. My teammates who all have significantly lower shooting attributes shoot around 50-60% (with heavily contested shots) yet I can't make more than 2-3 shots in a row even if all of them were wide open. The hit detection is absolute garbage. I've had some of my shots blocked only to look at the replay and see the guy who blocked me not even touch the ball. I watch as the ball just kinda glitchs through my hand as though the game was like: "Oh, hey you're about to make an easy layup? LOL I don't think so idiot!" Trying to get good at this game while playing the A.I. is like trying to make free-throws in real life while an evil leprachaun makes fun of you and punches you in the♥♥♥♥♥♥everytime you're about to make one. It's beyond infuriating. Either the A.I. is really easy to handle or it just makes you look like you should've never played video games in the first place. There is no challenging in between where it's not infuriating but I still have to work for it. The worst part about the difficulty scaling is that once you reach a certain rating with your player you feel the need to bump up the difficulty a little, otherwise it gets too easy and the game isn't fun. So as your player gets better attribute ratings you bump the difficulty up a little so that you can still play well but also have to keep working for it. However, it reaches a point where it gets so difficult that you may as well just sit back and simulate the games (unless your some kind of nba 2k17 god) it reaches a point where the game is working so hard to beat you that it is nearly impossible to play well, regardless of your rating. I may end up with 26 pts. when it's all said and done, which is good, but I'll probably end up shooting 20% just to get there. Shot timing is very finnicky, especailly on harder difficulties. Sometimes the shot meter even starts before you've caught the ball and you're stuck with a late release. Wouldn't it make more sense for the shot meter to start when, oh I don't know, you start shooting the actual ball!!!! I can't remember the number of times I wanted to shoot immediately off a pass  by holding down shoot only to see the shot meter is already past the threshold for a make before I even release the ball. It's completely counter-intuitive and frustrating. The best option is to wait until you've caught the ball and wait for a moment so that the pass catch animation can finish before you shoot. The only problem is it takes waaaaaay too long, so by the time you can actually make a shot, you sort of can't because the A.I. moves nearly perfect on defense (especially beyond pro difficulty). So, by the time you've gotten open, caught the ball, and are now ready to shoot, you have a defender in your face who will make you miss the shot anyway. Yet you can also watch your teammates make the same shots with no problem at all, as the A.I. gets a near perfect release just about every shot. These seem like such minor problems that should have been fixed through beta testing, but, I would be surprised if they beta tested it at all. For now, I don't recommend this game until they figure out a way to fix all the shoddy mechanics. Stay away from MyCareer, as fun as it is in the beginning it quickly becomes infuriating. Play with teams in online pvp or manage a team in MyGM/Franchise and leave it at that. It's pretty much all the game is good for at the moment.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 17, 2016
 Reply to downvoted reviews.  Honestly I don't know what all the fuss is about, the game ran great on 2k16 and now it runs even better on 2k17. I am running the game on the highest settings and getting 60fps with a gtx 760 t,i i7 870 cpu, some cheap ten year old motherboard and 8gb of ram. The game has never crashed, froze, or lagged. The game is everything you want. It's extremely well optimized in my opinion and the gameplay and features are really excellent.  Gameplay and features  Honeslty I'm a big my league fan and they have added so much this year. Now you can expand your league up to 36 teams (you can make or own or choose one of the 2k created ones which are very well made). Also you can vote on league changes, when it comes to removing the shotclock, ovetime sudden death changes, and many many more. Now my career is incredible because you have many cutsenes and every person has a unique storyline for their player. You can text people to come to your house to 1v1 or practice. Texting has different responses for every text you recieve.  The shot meter is a full bar for a green release which in my opinion I love. The game is more realistic than ever. You actually feel you are in an NBA game. They are 500 new animated. What I like about it is that the cpu now actually act like real players, they won't pass to you to the ball 24/7 anymore. When you create your plyer you choose a position and then a playstyle, whether its shotcreator, sharpshooter, or many more. There are actually 7 to choose from. Different stats go up and down as you adjust your height, weight, and wingspan. End   Now clearly I didn't say all the things about the game as it is a quick review. Park is the same but I still love it. I don't play my team but I know they added a TON to it. Well I hope this review was helpful and made you buy the game.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
												NBA 2K17 is a game that doesn't stray too far from the formula.  This isn't a bad thing of course, why fix what isn't broken?  The most significant changes come in the career mode, which, while fun to play can seem a little heavy on the 'grindy' side.  There are some occassional issues with animations stealing control from you, or getting muscled around by heavier, stronger characters, and even moments when my controller inputs stopped working momentarily, but it never stopped me from enjoying the core gameplay loop.Not much is new here in terms of gameplay, but the window dressing around it seems a lot nicer and more streamlined.  This is another solid entry in the 2K series, and definitely worth your time if you're a fan of videogame basketball.  Not like you have many alternatives anyway.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
												Due to having played NBA 2k for a decade, I have high expectations for these games.  The graphics are good, the offline play is good.   They made a change to allow you to sim to your teams draft spot instead of having to wait for every other team to pick their player in the draft.  That's where the good ends for me.  I tried playing myplayer but they have made these terrible cut scenes that you CANNOT skip until your completed one iteration of myplayer.  I tried and couldn't take it - it is too frustrating to be forced to watch cutscenes for a product that I've paid for, I shut it off after moving to my college team - I won't start it unless they patch in the ability to skip the cutscenes.The thing I live for in NBA 2k is playing against other people online, full court, NBA teams, I'm not interested in that mycourt stuff.  Playing online is terrible - the input lag is awful.  The players move around like they are skating on ice.  7 footers repeatedly miss uncontested 2 foot shots.  Instead of 7 footers simply laying the ball in or dunking they take fade away jumpers from 3 feet.  There are these repeated stupid canned animations for the ball rolling around the rim or bouncing up over the backboard to go out of bounds - it can happen upwards of 10-20 times in a 20 minute game.  They have made the defensive adjustments menu confusing.  Charges and over the back calls happen way too often.  I can't tell you how many times I will grab a defensive rebound and due to the input lag my player will then whip a full court shot.  Or try to make a fast break pass to an open teammate and the ball sails over my teammates head out of bounds - this happens 9/10 times on a fast break pass that is more than 20 feet.   The shot meter is awful.  There is in general difficulty even finding a match - they now have a timer showing the 'average wait time' for an opponent in online play but that is terrible information(and doesn't accurately reflect how long you will wait for a match) - give us a server browser, let us see players close to us, their ping, let us choose who we play against.  I'm upset there is no way to request a rematch after playing someone online.  There is no way to send a friend request after playing someone online.  There is no easy way to challenge someone ranked on the 2k leaderboards. You still can get to tip off only to discover you have both chosen the same jersey color, and if you've chosen the same team your game is going to be a pain in the rear.  As I said, I have high expectations but I don't think these are unreasonable things to expect from a basketball game in the year 2017.

content:
Posted: April 15
												I'm fairly new to the NBA 2K scene so I've only played 3 games in the series, 2K13 (on the WiiU), 2K16 and 2K17 (on PC). I have to say, this is possibly my least favourite out of the three on most fronts. I bought this game with early tip-off DLC for £19.First off, a positive. MyCareer is ok. I'ts better (story wise) than 2K16 (by a small margin) as it dosen't have weird, borderline impossible family relationships. It also focuses more on college basketball than highschool basketball before you reach the NBA. This is much better as, instead of making you pick a high school team that you know nothing about (as they don't exist outside the game) you go straight into picking from a handful of college teams.  There is however, a massive downside to the MyCareer section of the game. Although I wasn't really taken by the 2K16 storyline, 2K17 dosen't seem to have one at all! You rely on one sentace quotes during loading screens after your college games to tell you that (once again) you are the college student everyone is looking at drafting this season. It's generic, it's boring, but it's over pretty quick. You do actually get paid for college games this time based on your performance in the game which is nice, but kinda dosen't fit with the college scene. Then, out of the blue, you get a call inviting you to go and play for Team USA. I didn't really see the point of this as it felt really out of place. One minute you're in a classroom learning about biology and doing a team project, the next, you're playing with Team USA. Also, side note, the guy who calls you's voice acting is utterly terrible. It's so flat and boring to listen to and I couldn't find a way to skip it. One of the commentators does say that it's tradition to take a college player on the team, but the transition from doing school work to playing basketball is way too quick.When the draft comes around, you finally start to get to play NBA basketball. You seem to start off with better minutes than you do in 2K16. (This might be because I finally knew what I was doing this time as when I played 2K16, I didn't have a clue). After the draft, you go to your 'MyCourt'. This (for those who don't know) is your own personal, customisable space where you can shoot some hoops alone, or with friends. You can buy balls, backboards, wall murals, floors and much more.  In 2K16, the MyCourt looked really nice. It was sleek and it looked like a large, converted garage with lots of designated space to put earned memrobillia. 2K17's MyCourt is an old warehouse with a bar, snooker table and court. I really don't like the design and (as far as I'm aware), you can only place murals on one wall of the building and it's the wall you barely see unless you turn around and shoot towards the opposite hoop. MyPlayer feels downgraded too. Some features such as asymmetry and blemishes have been removed. The rest is pretty much the same as 2K16. Your players face is the only truely customisable thing. You can't really change their body shape par making them taller, shorter, a bit heavier or lighter. I set my player to the lightest he could be so that I had more speed. My sister actually came in while I was playing it and said 'why is he so fat?'. I would have liked to have had more control over my player as it dosen't really feel like he is truely 'my player'. I also had multiple issues with the face scanning via the 2K17 Companion App which resulted in me just sculpting it as normal and giving up with it. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but off-days during the regular season are just practice, or nothing. With 2K16, you had the option to go places with NBA stars, meet fans, attend sponsors events for extra VC and much more. All that seems to be gone now. I've only had one sponsor, and that was Nike for some custom shoes and the like. Also, when I try to load some items in the shop, I have to restart the game as it refuses to load the content. My internet connection is fine and this problem has happened multiple times while I've been playing the game. I also have the age old problem of players walking through chairs, putting their arm through other players and objects, coaches talking but their mouths not moving and multiple commentary errors such as how many free throws a player has been awarded. These issues have been in every NBA 2K game I have played. When you play the game, the other team (and your own players) actions, seem to depend on how well you play. If you don't stay with your assignment, the other team will be able to make rediculous 3 point shots and get them in the basket perfectly. It dosen't seem to depend on where the shooter is standing, how far away he is, who is defending him and so on. It makes play feel solo. Like you're not actually playing with a team. For example, I was playing the Cavs, and I passed the ball (accidently) to a player who was heavily guarded. It said I had a turnover (one of the Cavs players had touched the ball but my player still had the ball and play continued as normal). Because of this supposed 'turnover', my player missed the easiest lay-up I've ever seen, causing the Cavs to grab the rebound and make a 3 point shot from just over the middle of the court. This sort of thing has happened multiple times where I will guard the wrong person (as it keeps changing and I don't realise) and the other team will make stupid crazy shots from my mistake.    There are however some good features in this game (not that these excuse the bad features). The soundtrack IMO is better than 2K16 as there are less songs with massive chunks missing as they had to be censored out. The use of real world videos of outside teams staduims is very nice and the social media loading screen (although sometimes confusing due to the mix of dates) is quite a nice touch that keeps you up to date with what your fans think of you and your performance. Overall, as much as I would like to, I cannot reccomend this game at the RRP. If the game was £15 in a sale or something then it's worth it. I beleive 2K16 is a much better choice, even if it is flawed.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2016
												Best NBA simulation game ever. However, it is still a video game and has a ton of faults. Some that lead to extreme frustration. Some examples:-difficulty settings are not gradual. Playing on Pro is too easy and All-Star too difficult against AI. Your players miss open shots while the AI "NEVER" miss open shots (until rubber-banding kicks in towards the end of games). You can adjust the gameplay sliders for myGM mode, but not for myTeam.- players are lethargic recovering back to transition, and even after scoring a basket. I can't count how many times AI point guard made a half court pass to a wide open center under the basket for a dunk immediately after I scored. Even user controlled players are super slow to defent.- user controlled teammates are almost useless on defense. Jimmy Butler will lose his man ALL THE TIME playing on All-Star difficulty. C'mon man- offensive fouls are the dumbest in 2k17 since I can remember. They're called way too often, unless I'm trying to take a charge -- in that case the AI will just bump me and go right past the defender.- shot meter is different for all players and even different for the same player based on the shot, making it very difficult to time well. To make things worse, even if you match the meter almost perfectly but happen to go over, missed shot (even wide open) is almost guaranteed.- one of the most frustrating items in all of the 2k games is 6'1" point guards significally affecting layups of much taller offensive players. Countless missed layups. It includes dunks too. People with high dunk ratings will miss dunks when there's a defender nearby, no matter the size.- AI seem to be much better at FT% than their ratings (or real life stats) suggest- AI players shooting pull up 3s instead of easy layups on fast breaks (and always making them). EXTREMELY ANNOYING!!!- Dwight Howard hitting fadeaway jumpshots- Shooting guards will leave their assigments to cover Deandre Jordan at the 3 point line- goaltending called on dunks- one of my playoff runs had 0% attendance the whole time sans one game- crossovers consistently resulting in steals, no matter the dribbling skills of the ball handler- simulating games will consistently result in ridiculous results, to include 20% FG percentagesThis is not an all-inlcusive list of horse-dung in this game that will make you light your face on fire.All that said, an excellent game, a must have for any NBA fan.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2016
												In short, NBA2k17 is excellent from a gameplay standpoint. Pick a team and play with your friends and it's incredibly fun, as are most of the 2k games. Play on your own against the AI and it's incredibly fun. Play MyCareer and it's again just fun.But there are a few issues. I mostly play MyCareer and MyLeague. There aren't really any specific issues to MyLeague that aren't also in MyCareer, so I'll only talk about the latter.The biggest issue are the archetypes. I have no issue being limited in creating my player, after all it should still be realistic. That said what 2k did here isn't limiting, it's crippling. While the playing itself is fun, you won't create a superstar, like you did earlier in the series. You might be one, depending on how good you are at the game, but you could just choose a random role player and play just as good. If you only play myCareer it might not be apparent, but I have a higher rating than Patrick McCaw for example, but McCaw is clearly the better player, and it's not even close. I read that 2K is apparently tricking with their ratings in MyCareer, which to me seems to be the case.I understand that they want to make their competitive scene more interesting, but I think this is the wrong way.Another big problem is time. While it seems like they actually were able to cut loading times of games, the games feel a lot slower. What once was skippable pretty much immediately (timeouts and such) now takes forever. And while I appreciate the new style of the interviews, after the 10th time I just want to pick my answer and move on. Why do I have to watch myself walk out of the arena after every single game? Why do I have to watch myself walk at all outside of a game situation. I actually like the time managment and practice and all that, but just load. I don't want to wait ten seconds to walk out of my gym just so the game can THEN start to load.I probably forgot some things already. I can only stress that despite all of this the game is really fun. But if 2K were to improve some of these issues the game could be amazing. Right now it isn't, and that's so disappointing. At least it looks like 2K got back on track again after the abysmall 2k16.

content:
Posted: April 15
												I'm fairly new to the NBA 2K scene so I've only played 3 games in the series, 2K13 (on the WiiU), 2K16 and 2K17 (on PC). I have to say, this is possibly my least favourite out of the three on most fronts. I bought this game with early tip-off DLC for £19.First off, a positive. MyCareer is ok. I'ts better (story wise) than 2K16 (by a small margin) as it dosen't have weird, borderline impossible family relationships. It also focuses more on college basketball than highschool basketball before you reach the NBA. This is much better as, instead of making you pick a high school team that you know nothing about (as they don't exist outside the game) you go straight into picking from a handful of college teams.  There is however, a massive downside to the MyCareer section of the game. Although I wasn't really taken by the 2K16 storyline, 2K17 dosen't seem to have one at all! You rely on one sentace quotes during loading screens after your college games to tell you that (once again) you are the college student everyone is looking at drafting this season. It's generic, it's boring, but it's over pretty quick. You do actually get paid for college games this time based on your performance in the game which is nice, but kinda dosen't fit with the college scene. Then, out of the blue, you get a call inviting you to go and play for Team USA. I didn't really see the point of this as it felt really out of place. One minute you're in a classroom learning about biology and doing a team project, the next, you're playing with Team USA. Also, side note, the guy who calls you's voice acting is utterly terrible. It's so flat and boring to listen to and I couldn't find a way to skip it. One of the commentators does say that it's tradition to take a college player on the team, but the transition from doing school work to playing basketball is way too quick.When the draft comes around, you finally start to get to play NBA basketball. You seem to start off with better minutes than you do in 2K16. (This might be because I finally knew what I was doing this time as when I played 2K16, I didn't have a clue). I really don't like the design and (as far as I'm aware), you can only place murals on one wall of the building and it's the wall you barely see unless you turn around and shoot towards the opposite hoop. You can't really change their body shape par making them taller, shorter, a bit heavier or lighter. I set my player to the lightest he could be so that I had more speed. My sister actually came in while I was playing it and said 'why is he so fat?'. I would have liked to have had more control over my player as it dosen't really feel like he is truely 'my player'. I also had multiple issues with the face scanning via the 2K17 Companion App which resulted in me just sculpting it as normal and giving up with it. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but off-days during the regular season are just practice, or nothing. With 2K16, you had the option to go places with NBA stars, meet fans, attend sponsors events for extra VC and much more. All that seems to be gone now. I've only had one sponsor, and that was Nike for some custom shoes and the like. Also, when I try to load some items in the shop, I have to restart the game as it refuses to load the content. My internet connection is fine and this problem has happened multiple times while I've been playing the game. I also have the age old problem of players walking through chairs, putting their arm through other players and objects, coaches talking but their mouths not moving and multiple commentary errors such as how many free throws a player has been awarded. These issues have been in every NBA 2K game I have played. When you play the game, the other team (and your own players) actions, seem to depend on how well you play. If you don't stay with your assignment, the other team will be able to make rediculous 3 point shots and get them in the basket perfectly. It dosen't seem to depend on where the shooter is standing, how far away he is, who is defending him and so on. It makes play feel solo. Like you're not actually playing with a team. For example, I was playing the Cavs, and I passed the ball (accidently) to a player who was heavily guarded. It said I had a turnover (one of the Cavs players had touched the ball but my player still had the ball and play continued as normal). Because of this supposed 'turnover', my player missed the easiest lay-up I've ever seen, causing the Cavs to grab the rebound and make a 3 point shot from just over the middle of the court. This sort of thing has happened multiple times where I will guard the wrong person (as it keeps changing and I don't realise) and the other team will make stupid crazy shots from my mistake.    There are however some good features in this game (not that these excuse the bad features). The soundtrack IMO is better than 2K16 as there are less songs with massive chunks missing as they had to be censored out. The use of real world videos of outside teams staduims is very nice and the social media loading screen (although sometimes confusing due to the mix of dates) is quite a nice touch that keeps you up to date with what your fans think of you and your performance. Overall, as much as I would like to, I cannot reccomend this game at the RRP. If the game was £15 in a sale or something then it's worth it. I beleive 2K16 is a much better choice, even if it is flawed.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2016
												I have been purchasing and playing every NBA 2k game since 2005. This is the third one I own for PC (15,16,17). First of all this game has improved in the physics department in terms of you cannot simply pass through people and must actually manuever around them and rebounding/passing is more about your tmiing and position as opposed to spamming the button. However this game is by far the most flawed and incomplete NBA 2k game to date. The load times are still bad as ever (game is installed to my SSD), the shot stick has changed for the worse in terms of having to aim it in a particular "sweet" spot angle to get a close to perfect release. The slightest misdirection can result in an airball even for those that have HoF shooting badges. The online community is sadly divided into regions, which normally would not be bad but with the lack of people that buy this game for pc to play mypark it can make finding people to play with/against impossible at times. The rewards system does not work as I have unlocked myplayer reward cards that failed to redeem in myteam, people still get online with hacked stat characters that are 98 or more overall without having attained superstar mypark rep. The game has a nasty bug for those that run on 144hz or more with v-synch off that seems to affect text msgs in terms of it will scroll down super slow to a point it is not playable and cutscenes will move at a fast speed often resulting in them concluding before you can even hear all the dialogue. The game has a lot of pointless events and things to do that waste time and take away from the experience of just wanting to play basketball. Loading screens for everything. If you just enjoy the single player/offline experiences I would suggest this game for PC. However, if your looking for depth and serious about online play I would rec getting it on console as they seem to get patched and supported way faster than pc. Consoles have already received their first 7+ gb patch to resolve some issues while pc is left in the dust once again.PROS-Good physics-fun game-good shooting (with botton not stick)-lots to doCons-buggy-people hack and get away with it-lack of dev support for pc version-horrible load times-glitches for monitors higher than 60hz-myplayer - myteam card redeem issues-VC money hungry to almost force you to buy VC with real $If you like basketball you really have no choice as this is the only real basketball game to play. Enjoy it but do not have your expectations set to high and try not to fall for their VC cash grab. Earn it slowly but surely and use your actual $ for something productive.

content:
Posted: October 22, 2016
												The reason for not recommeding this game is I am unable to play a game other than pick up games on MyCourt with friends. Trying to play a Head - to - Head, Team-Up, or MyTeam games is impossible due to non-connections to 2kServers. As soon as we enter the match, we are immediately kicked out with the prompt of, "You have encountered a problem connecting with the game. Your session will be ended." every time. Without fail, every damn time. Being that I've owned the game since release, and being that there has been 4 patches since release, I would have expected to play with friends by now. But nope, no "luck" (As if luck needs to be part of their product). Regardless, if you're looking to play offline and single player, MyPlayer mode is about a 6.5/10 this year. RPG system they implemented seems tedious and inflated. Ratings will show a lot higher than the actual rating of your character. (i.e. a "90" rated player is somewhere in the high 70's or low 80's) Storyline is boring, and "immersion" into everyday scheduling is boring as hell. Would not waste $60 on this (imo single player game).Thanks, 2k. I have been a loyal customer since 2k7. Every year I'm disappointed, but you're my only option as a basketball fan. Guess I'll just have to drive my♥♥♥♥♥to my friend's house to go play your product. Being that it's 2016, you'd think we'd be able to play online consistently by now.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2016
												I have been purchasing and playing every NBA 2k game since 2005. This is the third one I own for PC (15,16,17). First of all this game has improved in the physics department in terms of you cannot simply pass through people and must actually manuever around them and rebounding/passing is more about your tmiing and position as opposed to spamming the button. However this game is by far the most flawed and incomplete NBA 2k game to date. The load times are still bad as ever (game is installed to my SSD), the shot stick has changed for the worse in terms of having to aim it in a particular "sweet" spot angle to get a close to perfect release. The slightest misdirection can result in an airball even for those that have HoF shooting badges. The online community is sadly divided into regions, which normally would not be bad but with the lack of people that buy this game for pc to play mypark it can make finding people to play with/against impossible at times. The rewards system does not work as I have unlocked myplayer reward cards that failed to redeem in myteam, people still get online with hacked stat characters that are 98 or more overall without having attained superstar mypark rep. The game has a nasty bug for those that run on 144hz or more with v-synch off that seems to affect text msgs in terms of it will scroll down super slow to a point it is not playable and cutscenes will move at a fast speed often resulting in them concluding before you can even hear all the dialogue. The game has a lot of pointless events and things to do that waste time and take away from the experience of just wanting to play basketball. Loading screens for everything. If you just enjoy the single player/offline experiences I would suggest this game for PC. However, if your looking for depth and serious about online play I would rec getting it on console as they seem to get patched and supported way faster than pc. Consoles have already received their first 7+ gb patch to resolve some issues while pc is left in the dust once again.PROS-Good physics-fun game-good shooting (with botton not stick)-lots to doCons-buggy-people hack and get away with it-lack of dev support for pc version-horrible load times-glitches for monitors higher than 60hz-myplayer - myteam card redeem issues-VC money hungry to almost force you to buy VC with real $If you like basketball you really have no choice as this is the only real basketball game to play. Enjoy it but do not have your expectations set to high and try not to fall for their VC cash grab. Earn it slowly but surely and use your actual $ for something productive.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
												Due to having played NBA 2k for a decade, I have high expectations for these games.  The graphics are good, the offline play is good.   They made a change to allow you to sim to your teams draft spot instead of having to wait for every other team to pick their player in the draft.  That's where the good ends for me.  I tried playing myplayer but they have made these terrible cut scenes that you CANNOT skip until your completed one iteration of myplayer.  I tried and couldn't take it - it is too frustrating to be forced to watch cutscenes for a product that I've paid for, I shut it off after moving to my college team - I won't start it unless they patch in the ability to skip the cutscenes.The thing I live for in NBA 2k is playing against other people online, full court, NBA teams, I'm not interested in that mycourt stuff.  Playing online is terrible - the input lag is awful.  The players move around like they are skating on ice.  7 footers repeatedly miss uncontested 2 foot shots.  Instead of 7 footers simply laying the ball in or dunking they take fade away jumpers from 3 feet.  There are these repeated stupid canned animations for the ball rolling around the rim or bouncing up over the backboard to go out of bounds - it can happen upwards of 10-20 times in a 20 minute game.  They have made the defensive adjustments menu confusing.  Charges and over the back calls happen way too often.  I can't tell you how many times I will grab a defensive rebound and due to the input lag my player will then whip a full court shot.  Or try to make a fast break pass to an open teammate and the ball sails over my teammates head out of bounds - this happens 9/10 times on a fast break pass that is more than 20 feet.   The shot meter is awful.  There is in general difficulty even finding a match - they now have a timer showing the 'average wait time' for an opponent in online play but that is terrible information(and doesn't accurately reflect how long you will wait for a match) - give us a server browser, let us see players close to us, their ping, let us choose who we play against.  I'm upset there is no way to request a rematch after playing someone online.  There is no way to send a friend request after playing someone online.  There is no easy way to challenge someone ranked on the 2k leaderboards. You still can get to tip off only to discover you have both chosen the same jersey color, and if you've chosen the same team your game is going to be a pain in the rear.  As I said, I have high expectations but I don't think these are unreasonable things to expect from a basketball game in the year 2017.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2016
												In short, NBA2k17 is excellent from a gameplay standpoint. Pick a team and play with your friends and it's incredibly fun, as are most of the 2k games. Play on your own against the AI and it's incredibly fun. Play MyCareer and it's again just fun.But there are a few issues. I mostly play MyCareer and MyLeague. There aren't really any specific issues to MyLeague that aren't also in MyCareer, so I'll only talk about the latter.The biggest issue are the archetypes. I have no issue being limited in creating my player, after all it should still be realistic. That said what 2k did here isn't limiting, it's crippling. While the playing itself is fun, you won't create a superstar, like you did earlier in the series. You might be one, depending on how good you are at the game, but you could just choose a random role player and play just as good. If you only play myCareer it might not be apparent, but I have a higher rating than Patrick McCaw for example, but McCaw is clearly the better player, and it's not even close. I read that 2K is apparently tricking with their ratings in MyCareer, which to me seems to be the case.I understand that they want to make their competitive scene more interesting, but I think this is the wrong way.Another big problem is time. While it seems like they actually were able to cut loading times of games, the games feel a lot slower. What once was skippable pretty much immediately (timeouts and such) now takes forever. And while I appreciate the new style of the interviews, after the 10th time I just want to pick my answer and move on. Why do I have to watch myself walk out of the arena after every single game? Why do I have to watch myself walk at all outside of a game situation. I actually like the time managment and practice and all that, but just load. I don't want to wait ten seconds to walk out of my gym just so the game can THEN start to load.I probably forgot some things already. I can only stress that despite all of this the game is really fun. But if 2K were to improve some of these issues the game could be amazing. Right now it isn't, and that's so disappointing. At least it looks like 2K got back on track again after the abysmall 2k16.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 22, 2016
												Every year they make changes to the game that make it worse in some way as they are mainly focused on increasing microtransactions.  They still can't figure out how to make the game half-way realistic, and instead simply adjust how much the computer can cheat physics.  The main reason I don't recommend this game is because you are at the whim of the computer almost the entire time you are playing.  Loose balls will bounce through 3 of your players but you won't be able to get to it because a portion of someone's foot is blocking you as you run in place.  A computer player will walk into your area and you get pushed back across the court like you're on an ice floor while your teammates watch. Myteam is a waste of time and simply there try and get you to spend money.  MyCareer is also pretty dumb.  It's cool to be able to build your own character into a star, but you have to sit through endless messages in a broken phone interphase, and cutscenes that add nothing but are forced to sit through.  MyLeague is not nearly as customizable as you would expect and ends up being pretty boring. If the basketball aspect of the game was better, the rest of the gimmicks wouldn't be as empty, but in the end the entire game seems cheap because of how sloppy playing an actual game feels.   It's not a very fun game and I definitely regret spending $60.

content:
Posted: February 24
												This game looks very great of the bat, The graphics are beutiful and the menus look awesome. BUTTTTT When you start scratching into the game it starts going downfill pretty fast, This game is a very PAY TO WIN as in MyCareer you start off with a 55 yes 55 overall meaning you will have to grind through hours of frustrating gameplay to earn VC to upgrade your character and after around say 30 hours of gameplay you will have a 75 overall at best, Meaning if you wanna skip all that gameplay you will have to pay and extra 40 dollars to get your overall to at best a 90. And the dynamic Orange Juice duo to me is just as stupid as "Frequency Vibrations", As I said before the gameplay can be very frustrating as for MyCareer it limits you to certain architects such as for PG and SG there is Sharpshooter (3 pointers) and Slasher (for drivers) and Shot Creater (Mid Range). This seems cool at first but the limitations are just to much, It stops you from making an all around star which is what most people want to be when they play MyCareer. And ingame can be just all out irritating as you will be struggling against teams that you should be blowing out like the Sixers and the Nets. When playing the game you will struggle alot in the 2nd,3rd and 4th quarters as you will likely miss countless of open shots as the game will start giving the opposing teams AI Gary Payton and Dikembe Mutombo like defense and you teamates just seem to lose interest and the game and start missing open shots and simply just stop putting in effort. This is just the MyCareer the MyLeague can also be very frustrating and say "2k cheesy" cause apparently Ronnie is a Sixers fan because despite we know how bad the Sixers are they for some reason eliminate me from the playoffs despite for ex me going 62-15 and the Sixers going 34-48 you will be eliminated, The game is very mindnumbingly annoying to the point I wanna scratch Ronnies eyes out, This game is♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥your wallets and I suggest you just stick to 2k13,14 or 15 cause those were the last good NBA 2ks.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												Mostly MyCareer games with a few Play Now games. Haven't tried MyTeam or MyGM, so this is mostly based off of the most popular mode.Pros:- I don't have to cringe twice a second for the Spike Lee cutscenes. Only once a second now.- Smoother and keeps the good mechanics from 2k16 and gets rid of the bad ones.- BS moves like hop-stepping into free fouls and pump faking into free fouls are reduced, but overall more fouls are being called based on experience.- Your coach isn't a big d!ck anymore. He's a smaller one now.- Your twin sister is gone. You're not forced to be black if you aren't.- Your business partner ain't the stereotypical money loving d!ck. Just a stereotypical money loving dude now.- Endorsements are more realistic.- Faster loading times (about 20% faster).- Your teammates don't miss wide open shots 90% of the time. Still missing them wide open layups though.- No more Spike Lee.- No more Spike Lee.- No more Spike Lee.- And finally: No more Spike Lee.Cons- Performance jitters here and there. Hopefully they get fixed.- MyCareer "MyCourt" takes too much time going through useless animations like walking through doors. WE GET IT. HE'S NOT A HOBO AND LIVE INDOORS.- Practice is mandatory and each has 3 drills. The upgrades takes at least 3x as long to get now with the must-do-drills system.- Instead of an annoying Vic that you were happy when he "disappeared", you get 2 nonsensical sidekicks that are playing alongside with you.- Way too similar to 2k16. Not much new aside from a attribute system that is a hybrid of past systems.- Cutscenes are glitched. The movie is fastforwarded while the sounds are played in normal speeds. Still good if you're like me and don't want to cringe that much.- The face scanning is buggy and can't identify me. I'm Asian so maybe my eyes aren't getting captured?

content:
Posted: February 24
												This game looks very great of the bat, The graphics are beutiful and the menus look awesome. BUTTTTT When you start scratching into the game it starts going downfill pretty fast, This game is a very PAY TO WIN as in MyCareer you start off with a 55 yes 55 overall meaning you will have to grind through hours of frustrating gameplay to earn VC to upgrade your character and after around say 30 hours of gameplay you will have a 75 overall at best, Meaning if you wanna skip all that gameplay you will have to pay and extra 40 dollars to get your overall to at best a 90. And the dynamic Orange Juice duo to me is just as stupid as "Frequency Vibrations", As I said before the gameplay can be very frustrating as for MyCareer it limits you to certain architects such as for PG and SG there is Sharpshooter (3 pointers) and Slasher (for drivers) and Shot Creater (Mid Range). This seems cool at first but the limitations are just to much, It stops you from making an all around star which is what most people want to be when they play MyCareer. And ingame can be just all out irritating as you will be struggling against teams that you should be blowing out like the Sixers and the Nets. When playing the game you will struggle alot in the 2nd,3rd and 4th quarters as you will likely miss countless of open shots as the game will start giving the opposing teams AI Gary Payton and Dikembe Mutombo like defense and you teamates just seem to lose interest and the game and start missing open shots and simply just stop putting in effort. This is just the MyCareer the MyLeague can also be very frustrating and say "2k cheesy" cause apparently Ronnie is a Sixers fan because despite we know how bad the Sixers are they for some reason eliminate me from the playoffs despite for ex me going 62-15 and the Sixers going 34-48 you will be eliminated, The game is very mindnumbingly annoying to the point I wanna scratch Ronnies eyes out, This game is♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥your wallets and I suggest you just stick to 2k13,14 or 15 cause those were the last good NBA 2ks.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												I've been playing NBA2K Since 2k9. Xbox, Playstation, PC, you name it I've played it. I am a MASSIVE basketball fan.Somehow they manage to make the UI and controls even less intuitive every single year. It's really depressing considering neither Madden or UFC bring their games to PC. Just a terribly designed game.Every year they change the controls inexplicably, and the in-game controls and menus are unbearable.Want to replace a player in your MyTeam? You can't just switch them. Make sure you scroll all the way over to your starter, select replace from bench, seperate for collection, and then scroll all the way back.Want to make a substituion in-game? Good ♥♥♥♥ing luck with the horrendous UI on court. You'll have to open the menu and make the sub.Oh! But now you're ♥♥♥♥ing PF is inexplicably guarding their PG! So go to defensive subs and change those too. BUT WAIT.  You can't ♥♥♥♥ing access defensive settings until the substitution is complete! But regardless of this, you have to ♥♥♥♥ing press A to go through each ♥♥♥♥ing indvidual in your active roster to find the player you want to guard him. NOT EVEN THE PLAYERS ON THE FLOOR, THE ONES FROM THE BENCH. And then you get to watch endless minutes of digital dancers and coach speak pressing A frantically hoping to just play the game.Don't even get me started on the MyPlayer, even worse than last year. Want to be an average kid from an average family who gets good at basketball? Too bad! You don't even get your own nickname anymore. You get endless cutscenes of you as some douchbag with a dead father and a black kids voice who rose from the bottom to be named 'Prez'. I can't have the voice of an Asian, Mexican, or White kid? I can't be from the suburbs like Bill Lambeer? Oh, and the first coin pack you buy doesn't even get you enough to buy a single card back in MyTeam.I hope this franchise dies off. Pathetic.Edit: The Warrios blew a 3-1 lead and then lost on Xmas day :))))

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 18, 2016
												Every Year, every year the same old bs..Mainly playing MyCareer and it still feels like they don't care or play their own Game at all.  NOt going to argue about the Story since its better than last Year Mr. Lee bs.2k thinks every Player plays an PG/SG/SF, because they haven't change the Practice for Positions like Center/PF. Its getting so annoying when you have to shoot 3 Pointers as Athletic Dunkmonster in Practice and obviously don't succeed.Then there are the Magic Combos your Mates on that Position can do, like behind the back in 360 Spin Moves and you can't even hit from 3 feet against an PG in Practice.So the Practice is frustrating as Center/PF, except when you choose to be an Big Stretch guy who can shoot 3s..In your NBA Career it won't get better, because the AI is just plain stupid and 2k loves to Script stuff. I well play on HoF.So you are a Center/PF but your Mates are keep Passing you the Ball every 2nd Attack in hope you do the PG or something.They will ignonre you when you are alone under the Basket just to keep Passing you the Ball when you left the Paint in Order to aviod the 3 Second Call, which will happen alot since 2k loves Animations inw hich you will get Stuck.So you supposed to be the Almighty College/High School Guy but you can't hit anything in the NBA even with Good Timing and being so Close to the Basket you can count the Dust particles on it.The Team AI is not there, they leave Guys open in Transition Defense while it would be an 3 vs 1 for our guys, but why would you protect the Rim?You Coach (Teammate Grade) is still crap, you still have to make all things yourself. So prepare to Cover 3 Guys, get Minus when a Block get grabbed 100m away from ya etc.The Movement is sloppy and it feels like i playing a guy who isn't sober for ages.MyTeam isn't working for me since Days, no replies so far on Twitter.Not to Mention the VC/MT Grind if you don't want to pay 90€ every 2 WeeksSome Pro Stuff:VisualsatmosphereContent2kTVCommentary

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 29, 2016
												The MyCareer story is a huge upgrade over last year's story. Several cool features have been added (including additions to MyGM/MyLeague). Gameplay-wise this game really feels a lot smoother than ever before, though the CPU in the game got a lot tougher (which is good!).The only problems I truly have with this game, is the fact that the archetypes limit you to been more of a role player instead of a true superstar. I get the point that I might be more balanced in online modes, but since I don't really MyPark or Pro-Am, I kind of miss the fact that I can't be my own GOAT.Some minor things that bother me are that you start at 55 overal as an All-american High school player. The story tells you that you are by far the best player on your College team, but usually (if you don't buy VC) you have no stat upgrades yet. It's kind of saddening to see 2K follow the EA's / Activision's of this world in money grabbing.I still recommend the game, but 2K could've definitely been a bit more lenient towards the start of MyCareer.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
												Pretty much rage deleted this pile of krap and for good reason. I am just sorry I wasted 60 dollars on it I really advise anyone looking at this game to at the very least WAIT till its cheaper. To start player control is atrocious. You can't cut to the basket, because you drift around. You can't pass on the dime because the AI for passing passes to the other team more than your own guys. It literally targets people across the court and into traffic when you want to toss it to the guy 5 feet from you. Sliders to fix this do nothing, I moved "openess" to damn near max to try and avoid the AI passing just throwing the ball to the other team....nothing fixes it,Of course the computer controlled teams suffer from none of this. And they cheat incessantly, and it gets annoying fast. But lets get down to why I rage deleted this game....this is the best part. I created my league, spent hours creating a pair of players, arranged rosters, meticulously setup their playtime rotations, I engaged in trades, scoured free agents to build the perfect team for the playoffs. Then...I played a FULL flippin season, like what a 100 games or something? I started simulating against easy teams and played contenders to keep myself the top team. So after all the hard work, I am trying to do the same in the playoffs. I play a few games get ahead of the team I am playing off against, and decide to go ahead and sim some of them. Fine I win the first matchup, so I decide to sim the second series and just play when and if it was close......well...with one button press I accidently simmed the entire thing.In like 2 seconds all that hardwork went down the drain, my team simmed to the finals and lost, despite my team being the strongest by far mind you. Never mind that I actually wanted to play the last series. But no it simmed to the end, and it autosaved the results, a quick ALT F4 did nothing. Literally DISGUSTED, you can't undo it...right because that would be "cheating"....so they effed my whole season up...with some clunky ridiculous interface with no way to undo it or redo it. This game is a pointless pile of steaming krap. You'd do well to stay as FAR away from it as you can.Honestly the last game I buy from them EVER!!!And to clarify I was not even selecting the last game, I selected the second series, yet some how in its inconsistent BS interface had an option to just skip the playoffs from any box on the playoff diagram....not on the last one mind you where it might logically be!! No 2nd tier playoffs top option on the menu is to sim the ENTIRE thing with no way to stop it.EFF you NBA2K17!!

content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												Even after just a few hours, I am truly impressed with the latest from the 2k devs. They added and refined so much in this franchise from last year that it is truly amazing. I have been playing the series for a few years now and unlike EA's small incremental improvements, I have to say 2k is determined to impress every year. Even without competition from EA they go above in beyond in presentation and polish this year and in years past. Unlike EA, 2k knows how to put out a quality product consistently.Very impressed, and it is running beautifully on my high-end pc. content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
												One word: LackingGeneral Graphics:+ Improved lighting and shadowing+ Improved crowd animation- Body structures are too thin for some players (Dom Wilkins? Yao Ming? Even some coaches. come on)- The eyes are too big for most of the players- face scanning of most of the players are off (it's better last year)General gameplay:+ Smooth passing mechanics (you can actually feel the rush of touch and flashy passes)+ Improved dribbling mechanics (you have more control over your player)+ Improved post move mechanics (no more spin cheese and dream up and under is more realistic)+ Improved stealing mechanics (although it makes it easier to steal and intercept)+ Improved layup mechanics (variety of moves with less pre-animations)+ Managing your stamina is a key- charge foul is unrealistic (even if you're on a fast break, they'll call a charging foul on the half court line!)- Fastbreak passes are pretty hard now when playing with slashers like LBJ since they'll just go to the corner instead of going straight to the basket.- The moving screen of the bigman that drags you and leaves your opposing player wide open on three- The ball still doesn't have the right bouncing physics- The pass button are sometimes delayed that's why when I pass the ball to a player, it then passes it to the other- Most of the time, AI players are fast to recover on fastbreak which is unrealisticMyCareer:+ Face scanning is available now (although not yet perfect)+ Practice is never a chore now (but it's kinda repetitive and boring)+ Improved story-line that introduced a new concept of controlling two players+ Improved connections (players and endorsements)+ Improved mycourt atmosphere+ HOF difficulty is manageable (lesser shotclock cheese and you can actually defend players now)- badges accumulation (I understand it would limit cheesers in MyPark but MC is not that enjoyable to play now)- Sharpshooters are way too OP (at least for now)- double team is a mess (Yeah your points would be limited now, instead you get monster assists with 20+ per game)- Mid range for other archetypes other than a Sharpshooter is broken- Timeouts are irritating since you can't skip it immediately instead let your coach say some of his line firstMyTeam:+ Better domination rewards+ Improved difficulty on domination+ Challenge Tokens and rewards+ Balanced player ratings- Can't buy boxes in MT which forces you to buy it in $$Miscellaneous:+ menu and the fonts (modernistic with a touch of simplicity)+ music tracks- FPS sometimes stuck at 54-57 on some courts in 2K camera which is odd since my rig is way above the recommended specs- keyboard not working on Pro-AM and MyPark (which should not be the case since this game is on a PC platform)- Pirates can access online -- MyCareer, MyPark, and Myteam (like why did I bought this in the first place?)My rating:6.5/10 Buy it with discount______________________________________________________________EDIT AFTER 500mb PATCH:+ No more FPS stuck+ Fixed other gameplay issues+ Pirates can't access online anymore+ They're starting to banned online hackers and cheatersMY RATING AFTER 500mb PATCH:7/10
